Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience.”
Reviews.Author: Persia69
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in Istanbul. From the complimentary airport transfer, free drink upon arrival, and consistant, supportive and friendly staff during our stay this hotel has everything you need. The location is excellent with a short walk to all the major sites including shops and restaurants. The room was large, the bed was soft and the shower was hot and strong. The choice for breakfast was huge and eating among the ruins was an experience. We stayed for seven nights and could have stayed longer as there is so much to see and do in Istanbul and the Acra contributed to our fantastic holiday. Loved the afternoon tea, the extremely helpful staff and can't wait ti go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: kjrp115
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Acra in November and could not have been more pleased. The rooms were spacious and clean. The Breakfast plentiful. It was only a few blocks from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Good restaurants along the way. We just loved the breakfast room with the parts of the old city wall running through it. Charming. Could not have been more pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “PRICE,LOCATION,SERVICE,& CLEANLINESS!!”
Reviews.Author: Asharky
Reviews.Content: We were in Acra in Feb. 2012. We booked two rooms one for me, my husband and 2yr old son and one for our moms. Not sure where to start from. Our experience with Acra and it's staff was unforgettable. From booking in US, than the pickup at the airport to our last goodbye with the staff standing outside waving us goodbye. Check-in was fast and very helpful. They don't have room service but people at front desk were willing to help us with anything we asked for such as milk for my son or ordering pizza from dominos with a deal. He did it all and my mother in-law even said, "this feels like home." Breakfast: It was a buffet with fresh eggs, breads, olives and other turkish delights to cereal etc. Everything one might need to have a complete satisfying start of the day. Staff at the breakfast was very helpful. I had to make instant oatmeal my son and they let me use their microwave in the kitchen and anything I needed. Location: It's perfectly located in the Old town. A short walk to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Grand bazaar. Yet it's away from the loud streets where tourists are shopping. Rooms: Rooms are VERY CLEAN and big enough for you. We had two strollers, three suite cases and a crib but we still were easily moving around the place. Sheets are soft. I'm very big about the bedding and the bathroom and I was happy with both. They have elevator and that was a huge thing for us because most of the boutique hotels don't have elevators. Also they provided us with a complimentary one way pickup from the airport. Overall this hotel has the standards of a FIVE STAR but because they are a boutique hotel they can't rate as a five star. I would say DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON FOUR SEASONS OR ANYTHING ELSE BOOK ACRA. I would've listed names of the staff that helped but I can't give one or two names. I think EVERYONE WAS GREAT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lance C
Reviews.Content: Great service! The staffs were very helpful and tried to do whatever was asked. The location was very close to most of all the major sites in Istanbul. Walk to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia was less than 5 mins. Lot of restaurants and markets nearby which open late. Very safe area, had no hesitation about walking late at night with 2 small children. If we go back to Istanbul, the Acra Hotel will be our first option.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel + location”
Reviews.Author: Aka808
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family of 6 and 2 small children. Great locale service and the staff helpful at each stage. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “1st visit but not the last.”
Reviews.Author: jobly
Reviews.Content: We have been to Istanbul 4 times now and enjoyed every trip but this Hotel was by far the best small, beautiful,has amazing staff and the rooms were fabulous. We think that this Hotel is perfection and would recommend it to anyone. When we return to Istanbul this is the Hotel where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “You will not get better !!”
Reviews.Author: Derek W
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Istanbul after spending 3 nights in the Acra hotel. I am a business man who spends his life travelling the world and spending too many nights in hotels. Most of them 5 star hotels in the United States or Asia. But believe me this hotel is wonderful. Great location, spotless rooms, shower that almost knocked me of my feet and some of the most helpfull, cheerfull and efficeient staff that you will ever meet. If ever I have to go back to Istanbul I have one very easy decision to make.... I will stay in the Acra. Well done Acra, you deserve to be full all the time. Derek UK

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing”
Reviews.Author: gez60
Reviews.Content: I held my 60th birthday in Istanbul, we stayed at the wonderful Acra hotel. Not only is the hotel beautiful and perfectly located, the staff are just amazing and we love them all. We will be back later this year to see them. They are a memorable part of my birthday memories. Thank you lovely staff at Acra.....see you soon. Lots of love, Geraldine & Euan GrantXXXXXXXX

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Look no further”
Reviews.Author: S A
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the hotel for six nights and stayed in room 403. I must say the hotel was absolutely fantastic and better than we had expected. The staff were really friendly and very helpful. The location was perfect - Close to all the sites The room was really nice and better than I had expected. The staff even provided a cot for my son at short notice. Oh and not to forget the high power shower with hot water!! All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Istanbul. Dont look any further. Traveler from UK

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: GypsyRae
Reviews.Content: My trip to Istanbul was a dream, my stay at the Acra Hotel was perfect. For my first time in Istanbul this hotel was conveniently located near the historical center the staff was helpful and dependable. They offer a variety of services and transportation. Most of all the Hotel was beautiful with the most elegant furnishings. I hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: Roazzura
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to Istanbul, where I was accomodated at Acra Hotel. I picked the hotel for the entire group I was travelling with after reading these reviews and everyone was satisfied with my choise. The hotel is perfectly located on a quiet street in Sulthanamet, close to Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque (around 5 minutes on a lazy walk). First of all, I have to say the staff is great - very friendly and helpful. As we arrived early in the morning, they arranged a few rooms for us before check-in time, in order to leave our luggages. In the mean time, we were served with tea or coffee. Then, they arranged for us a cruise trip over the Bosphorus at a resonable price. When we came back, there was a cake buffet in the lobby - and I must say the buffet is served daily, in the afternoon, with tea and sweets. Rooms were spacious, nice furbished - with a touch of oriental style, very clean (as seen in the official hotel's pictures). They were provided with flat TV screen, tea corner, minibar, safe box and all the necessary in the bathroom. The ones in upper floor had nice view over the sea or Sulthanamet. Breakfast was good, with sweets, turkish food, different kinds of cheese and even two tipes of comb with honey. We really enjoyed our stay and they were even kind enough to let us check-out later, as our flight was in the afternoon and there were rooms available. I have to say this hotel was the best choise I could have made, due to its location, accomodation conditions, services and friendly stuff. I would really go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay at Sultanahmet!”
Reviews.Author: MassiZurlo
Reviews.Content: Before I make my reservation to this hotel I read the comments here, and decided to do it. I had some doubts about noise, but hopefully there was nothing noisy disturbing. The hotel is really close to historical center and also thanks to there are variety of transportation you can go wherever you want in istanbul. Rooms were clean and hotel was as in photos, nothing incomplete that is really satisfying. Wifi works very well.On the other hand h otel staf was very sensitive to the demands of guests and always friendly. Breakfasts were delicious, there were variety of foods and also everything was fresh. I thank you again all of the hotel staf for this good vacation, I strictly advice you to choose this hotel, you won't be unpleased.

Reviews.Title: “I had the BEST VACATION with the BEST LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: Aisha A
Reviews.Content: I can honestly recommend this hotel due to many reasons: the hotel itself is built on top of ORIGINAL BYZANTINE MONUMENTS (you can find them in the breakfast area), which gives it a very special touch and the location is just perfect!! 5-minutes walking distance from the famous Sultan Ahmet Masjid and another 10 walking minutes to the KAPALI CARSI (GRAND BAZAAR) and the Metro. It is indeed a very central and lively, yet quiet spot in Istanbul. On to the hotel: It is in the style of a cozy Turkish-style "mansion" and is located midst of an homely district, which gives you a feeling to literally live in Istanbul even though it's only for the time being. The ENTIRE STAFF of the hotel is very professional, extremely friendly and they will go out their way to fulfill one's demands, whether it is in arranging a city tour, giving you precisely intro about the city itself and to call a pizza service for you! At any time of the day you will be (at least) offered a glass of turkish tea or coffee and that free-of-charge! The rooms are tastefully furnished and quiet spacious and as well as the bathroom. Housekeeping is doing an excellent job by keeping the rooms in a great and tidy shape. THE MATTRESSES ARE VERY COMFORTABLE! I have never in my life slept so well on mattress, leave alone in a hotel! Breakfast has a large variety of food; from local (turkish) delicacies to international dishes. Last, but not least, the hotel even has its own cat (I called it Garfield, because it has a brownish / orange fur and is very cute). PLEASE CONTACT MS. OZLEM, who is the hotel manager and she will support you as much as she can. She answers emails almost immediately (same day response is a guarantee) and she is taking care of individual preferences. There is only 1 thing that I want to mention here to look out for: if you are a sensitive person, please let the hotel know to give you a "quiet" room. I had a corner room and was extremely happy with it, although I am very noise sensitive and we even had a view of the sea :) I will be a repeating guest for sure!!! Greetings from Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Eclipsee05
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to be. All main historical sites are at few minutes walk. Service is very good, our room Was clean and big. No noise from outside. A special thanks to Mesut, Mesut jr, Mehmet and Firat, Who are everytime kindly and gave us perfect advises for our journey. Breakfast Was very good with a lot of salad and honey choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, lovely people.”
Reviews.Author: EperAgi
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 4 nights at hotel Acra during our Istanbul city break. The welcome was warm and friendly and we have been offered cakes, sandwiches and tea to help us unwind from our long (ish) trip from the Airport. We got a room on the reception level. The room was nice, clean and was equipped with a large double bed, 2 armchairs, coffee table, TV, tea making facilities, hairdryer, extra pillows and blankets. We had breakfast at the hotel most mornings and the buffet breakfast was extensive and fresh. Every afternoon the hotel prepared cakes and pastries with tea or coffee for the guests in the lounge area, which we thought was a nice touch and definitely appreciated after a long day sightseeing. Unfortunately the proximity to the breakfast area and our noisy neighbours woke us up on a regular basis. Despite this we have a very good time.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: FrannySpain
Reviews.Content: Have visited the Acra Hotel in December on a 4 day stopover and now on a one day stopover. The location in the Old City is perfect: you are minutes away from most historical places. Everything you need is in the room. The staff is very nice. Good wifi internet access. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean premises, friendly & courteous staff.”
Reviews.Author: Dee1412
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, really friendly and courteous staff! It's a newer hotel, that was one of our main reasons to choose and also walking distance to many attractions, however its a 10 min. walk to the tram station. Breakfast was ordinary, almost the same every day. The front desk staff and everyone were really really nice! I'd stay or recommend anyone. The drawbacks were that its a hike to tram station and you don't NEED to take Taxi for commuting, trams are the way to go... inexpensive, clean and available frequently. Breakfast was there, that's it! Nothing fancy! If you are doing historical sites, you can stay here for a day or two and may choose to stay closer to tram stops, as it's really convenient! The staff was kind enough to upgrade us to a family room as we had lot of baggage as we were headed to India after Istanbul. There were no views from either side though, but we were there to use it mostly for bed and breakfast and were out for the most of the day! Bathrooms were nice and very clean with ample toiletries, good water pressure in the shower and were cleaned and updated with towels daily. What they have going for them is their staff and the cleanliness. TV offered almost no entertainment, most channels are in Turkish. Liked the free internet, which helped us plan our next day regarding the places to visit and choose where we wanted to eat. The city is very safe, area around the hotel is very safe to walk even late in the evening. One thing's for sure, there were too many cats anywhere you go in Istanbul. The whole area is saturated with hotels, so if you were to choose anything nearby, as far as proximity to Blue mosque, Aya sophia and Topkapi palace is concerned, you'd be fine.

Reviews.Title: “just what we expected”
Reviews.Author: sljokica
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul for 4 days at the begining of January. Hotel, really, was as on the photos. Room was very clean, warm. Bedding was perfectly white, I liked it. Breakfast was totally ok. Only, walls were too thin, but we had lucky that there was no litlle kids next to us. And also, we were so tired that we didn't hear anything, including early morning singing from Blue mosqe. Position of hotel is just perfect if you want to feel old city spirit. Taxi from airport to hotel is 17 euros. But also, you have in the neigborhood organised transfer to airport for 5 euros per person, but we didint try it. Restaurants on this Gold horn side are double expensive than the other bank, so... Also, if you want to buy lockum for take away, go across Galata Bridge, it's twice cheaper. It is very usefull to buy three days ticket for Topkapi, Agia Sophia, Hora museum. It's cheaper, but more impoortant is that you wait in line for buying it only once. Next time, we gonna choose Acra Hotel again, for sure

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice!”
Reviews.Author: LMM1991
Reviews.Content: Put this hotel at the top of your list when visiting Istanbul. Conveniently located within easy walking distance to Hagia Sophia and the old city. One of the big "make or break" criteria for me is how clean the room is. Acra did not disappoint...our room was very clean and comfortable. Wireless internet in the room was easy to access and fast. Continental breakfast was good...nothing too remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: JMM1988
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Acra during a short trip to Istanbul just before Christmas. Overall one of the nicer hotels (>10) we've stayed at during the past year. Staff was friendly and helpful as well as fluent in English. The room was very clean and comfortable. Since there are 3 in our family, the family suite was perfect for us. Continental breakfast was good. Acra is located within easy walking distance from Hagia Sophia and the old city section of town. Grand Bazaar is within walking distance or 2 stops away on the tram. Would definitely stay here if visiting Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: w_cooksey
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul for a short break in December and stayed at the Acra Hotel. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel really welcome by the staff. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the room was very comfortable. Breakfast was good. Staff were extremely helpful and professional and couldn't do enough for you. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to all the sights and the Grand Bazaar. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Would visit again any time!”
Reviews.Author: CJerome
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul and stayed at the Acra Hotel in May 2011 for a week. From the moment we arrived the staff was welcoming, helpful and easy to talk with. The location is excellent for touring the old city. We were able to walk to the blue mosque in less then ten minutes. All the other sights including the grand bazaar and spice market(a little longer walk but not bad at all) are walkable too. The staff provided great suggestions and reservations for restaurants. Highlights of the hotel include the breakfast every morning, more then enough to fuel you to lunch and the afternoon tea/snack service in the lobby. The cake with fruit was our favorite! The rooms were quite spacious. Ours faced the water with a view of ships coming and going. Our parents faced the old city with a view of the blue mosque. Coming back to the staff, they really made our visit. Many are fluent in english(other languages too) and even those that are learning english made an effort to communicate and help us. We would visit again any time! Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “excellent five star service”
Reviews.Author: hamadbahrain
Reviews.Content: Mesut & team took gr8 care of us. Friendly pleasant helpful professional prompt staff. Homely cosy quiet family oriented hotel. Will recommend anyone for this hotel & wud come back here again myself too. Brilliant !!

Reviews.Title: “it was nice costumer services :)”
Reviews.Author: sinan s
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Acra hotel. The staff and in particular Mesut were very professional and incredibly helpful. They ensured that all my arrangements and requests were met and all in all were very accomodating. The facilities were first class and my room was very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning to come to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with Even better staff”
Reviews.Author: Zara R
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul for 5 days last month and choose Acra due to the good reviews I saw on this website. I was picked up from the hotel for free as I booked through their website and also had my room upgraded on arrival as I had a baby with me. The room was cosy and spacious with a cot for my baby. Throughout our stay the guys at the hotel looked after us. They were always more than happy to give us directions to the different attractions in Istanbul and always arranged a taxi for us when needed. They provide a lovely breakfast for free and the room was always spotless when we arrived back from our days adventure. The hotel is within walking distance of all the major attractions. You can walk to the Blue Mosque, Hajjia Sofia, Underground Palace and Topaki Palace within 6 minutes. Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar are a 15 minute walk away. I thought Iâ€™d need a full 5 days to visit all the attractions but done it quite easily in 3. I canâ€™t thank the guys at the hotel enough for looking after us. It was our first family holiday and the guys at the hotel played a big part in making it memorable. Special thanks to Mesoud who was star throughout. My baby girl says hello if the guys at the hotel are reading this review.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: strongbow18
Reviews.Content: The free airport transfer (for booking more than 3 nights) was useful on arrival. The hotel itself is small and in a quiet street, a stones throw from Topkapi Palace and close to Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. I had read that the staff were very helpful and I can confirm this. They were always ready to advise and solve problems in very good English. We had a superior double room each on the first floor and they were well equipped and extremely clean but not cheap for off season. Breakfast was in the historic basement and there was a good choice so I had a good balanced meal each morning. There is a street of restaurants close by and we sampled some of them for dinner with mixed results. One night I asked at reception about a fish restaurant and we were given free transport to and from a very good one which was reasonably priced. Perhaps the car was because it was off season. We also received free transport to a Turkish Bath (hammam) which cost around â‚¬22 each including massage. We walked around the old city a lot and it was always a pleasure to return to the sanctuary of the hotel for a rest. Tea was usually offered as soon as we entered the premises. I have stayed in a number of hotels in Sultanahmet through the years and this is my favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and warm-hearted service !”
Reviews.Author: krystatzelepi
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 23-25th November 2011 at Acra hotel. The people at the hotel were very helpful in guiding us how to get around, very kind in meeting our extra requests and made the extra effort to make our stay fully enjoyable! the hotel serves a very good breakfast with many of their own turkish products: yogurt and honey with honeycomb, freshly baked rolls etc. they also serve tea and sweets every afternoon in the lobby, complimentary. I would recommend it to everyone who would like to have a good stay and also feel at home. Krysta - Athens Greece

Reviews.Title: “i think so this hotel is the best hotel in sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: baron v
Reviews.Content: acra hotel very good hotel.and its so near to blue mosgeu,grand bazaar,space bazaar.ottoman's palace and personals are so helpfull and friendly.mostly i like mehmet and mesut.they help me lot.im sending both of u all my regards.thnx a lot ur guys.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother looking at any other hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irishgirlabroad
Reviews.Content: We were only able to stay one night at the Acra Hotel (as we were in transit) but it was a wonderful experience. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left the staff were great. They happily arranged airport transfers and recommended a great restaurant for dinner. The hotel is located in a quiet street of the Sultanamet but is within very easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque and other main attractions. The "hop-on/hop-off" tour bus also starts nearby. There are plenty of shops, bars and restaurants in the streets nearby and you get a friendly smile and welcome from everyone. The rooms are extremely comfortable, good bedlinen and towels and all the hotel is extremely clean. It is a nice touch to have a kettle in the room to make a cuppa. The breakfast room is lovely with sections of the old walls incorporated into it...there was a reasonable selection of food for breakfast that should suit all tastes. We walked around the local streets and noticed quite a number of small boutique type hotels and guesthouses but I honestly would advise not to bother going anywhere other than the Acra. Great to have free wi-fi as well !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, good value, central”
Reviews.Author: Bones6t
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Acra Hotel, Istanbul in October 2011. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and well appointed.The hotel is close to the Blue Mosque and other sights. It is a 10 minute walk to the tram stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GusCanada
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous experience at the Acra Hotel. The staff couldn't be more welcoming and helpful. The tea/coffee and cakes served every afternoon in the lobby (and the free WIFI) was a lovely touch and much appreciated after a long day of touring. The location in the Old City is very convenient. Breakfast buffet was nicely done. I would highly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in the city ! Fantastic stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RedTsarina
Reviews.Content: We are just returning from a 7-nights stay at the Acra. If you're looking for a very big, modern tower hotel with impersonal staff, then Acra Hotel is not for you. But if you're looking for a lovely hidden gem, a corteous, smiling, fantastic and very helpful staff, a place you call "home" when getting back to your hotel after exploring this wonderful city all day long, there you have it. This is exactly what this place is. Rooms are spotless clean (the entire hotel is), the breakfast is included, absolutely excellent and offers a large choice of food, you will take it in a gorgeous place where some ancient walls from the Great Palace are visible, location is unbeatable (Blue Mosk, Haghia Sophia, Cistern Basilica, Topkapi Palace are within 5 mns walking distance, Grand Bazaar is 15 mns walking distance, Spice Bazaar is 20 mns walking distance etc...), lots of taxis everywhere, Arasta Bazaar is at your door, lots of very good restaurants all around, cookies, delicious cakes and losts of good things are waiting for you in the lobby everyday between 3.00-6.00 pm for an afternoon tea and, last but not least, I had never ever experienced such a fantastic welcome. YOU GUYS AT THE RECEPTION ARE THE BEST and it was hard to leave you all yesterday ;-)))) Ask all your questions, they will be more than happy to answer and help you with a smile. I know the boss is reading this : if you do, they all deserve a nice pay rise haha! Thanks to you all, you made our stay in this wonderful city absolutely fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely..”
Reviews.Author: the_spinsterella_SG
Reviews.Content: We staued 7 nights at Acra Hotel in June and didn't have time to provide a review till now. Location : Perfect. It is within 5 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern and Topkapi Palace. The tram and restaurants are also around the Blue Mosque area so the location is convenient. However, take note of the shops around the area, some of them are out to make as much from you as possible so I'd recommend checking out the prices elsewhere(ie, near the tram, Grand Bazaar or Spice Bazaar) before buying anything there. Despite all the amenities nearby, the hotel is on a quiet street so that was very good. Room : We were put on a room on the ground floor on the first couple of days but was told to move to another room on the 2nd floor. We prefer the room on the 2nd floor as the room on the 1st floor was very noisy ie. there was a dog at the hotel next to Acra and that dog kept barking the whole day and night! The 2nd floor room was slightly smaller but much nicer. Both rooms were cosy and perfect if you are on your honeymoon. I love the colour theme and furniture. :-) The bed is super comfy - reminds me of the beds at a certain 5 star Hotel chain - but it's smaller ie. Queen sized. We're used to King size bed but we find the bed as comfy. The airconditioner is good and the bathroom a good size. However, it would be better if there is a hand bidet as well. Overall I was impressed with the room. Food : Breakfast was served at the lovely basement. The food was almost the same everyday but I didn't mind that. The cakes served during breakfast and tea are to die for - I've never tasted cakes this good even at 5 star hotels in and outside of Singapore. The hotel provide cakes and tea in the afternoon at the lobby for free. That was really thoughtful and it was wonderful to come back and have a slice of the lovely cakes. Service : The 2 Mesut, Lale and the other staff were very helpful. Mesut offered us free breakfast when we arrived in the morning and showed us a map of Istanbul and showed us where the places of interest are. That was really thoughtful and kind of him. We didn't get that kind of service even at most 5 star hotels! The staff were ready to give us information and always ask us how our days were. The staff will never fail to greet you when they see you. However, I must add that we were a bit upset when we were told to change room and nobody apologize for that even though it's really inconvenient to pack all our things and to unpack them again afterwards. I felt that could be handled better. The good thing was that they kept their promise that the room was just as good - actually in fact, we preferred the 2nd room. Others : The hotel has free wi-fi. We had no trouble surfing the internet from our laptop and phones. The facade and lobby of the hotel were cosy and nicely decorated. Elegant but not ostentatious. The hotel does not have rooftops like the other hotels nearby but would you rather a bigger room or a rooftop? All in all, I'd say it was an enjoyable stay at Acra Hotel. I'd recommend Acra Hotel and I'd definitely stay there when we come to Istanbul again. Like the previous reviewer, I'd say that the hotel is 4.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Acra Hotel - Cordial, Warm and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: taimoorpervaiz
Reviews.Content: Acra is located at a very convienient location with walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome and the rest. This is quite important if you have young children as you would not want to be travelling to and fro from the places to visit with kids complaining of being tired. The room was tidy, the room service was prompt, the breakfast had a huge variety and was made up of a healthy menu. The staff was extremely friendly always greeted you with a smile and were always willing to assist in whatever way they can. Reservation was quite ably handled by the staff. One of the staff members Masut was extremely cordial, helpful and honest in his advice for every query I had. I think our stay was made better because of him. Istanbul is a charming city and you need to have a pleasant place to stay to enjoy the city and we are glad we choose Acra. Thank you to all the staff at Acra for making it possible. Visited Istanbul 22-27 October 2011 as a family with 2 young children

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: PeterandPam152
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in the Acra Hotel and could not fault anything. The staff were efficient, friendly and helpful. Mesut was a fountain of useful information. After spending a day walking around Istanbul, it was a delight to return to the Acra for complementary tea and cakes. Our room was immaculate and beautifully furnished and the breakfast was fabulous in an unsual and historic setting. Thank you Ozlem and your team, we will definitely be coming back. Peter and Pam

Reviews.Title: “Good option with few minus”
Reviews.Author: Glawen_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Sulthanamhet, so old city, so few minutes walking from all the nicest , greatest historical places in Istanbul: great location. Acra is a small hotel with really nice and clean rooms, as well as a great and friendly staff. These guys are able to make the difference: we had a problem in the bathroom they solved it, we were in the need of directions to dine-out they were able to provide really good option nearby. Furthermore room service was good during all our stay. Furthermore a really nice idea is the tea around 5pm. A really valuable idea if you come after a cold and rainy day, you may have some relax before going out for dinner with a tea and some pastries. A suggestion while booking: room rates on standard booking websites were higher than on Acra website. Contact them directly (by email or phone) to get a better understanding of the different room options (family, with views, ...) ... and of the rates Price: probably is not the most cost effective hotel in Sulthanhamet, but I think it can provide a good value for your money A couple of minus: Breakfast: lot of food, but sometimes the bread for the toast was not so fresh, one morning they were proposing a cake, the morning after we were served with the slices of the same cake, we found an insect in the honey, the pears were hard like stones ... so probably they should put some effort on improving breakfast, since they claim to be a four stars hotel! This is the main reason why i reduce my mark No terrace: most of the hotel nearby have a terraces, Acra none yet Bathroom: Clean, even if some mould in the shower box. The first day, one shower box was not working but they solved it. Both bathrooms have no windows, so it usually took a long time to have "fresh air" again, this is unpleasant and it should be addressed!

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mansoor N
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Acra in September 2011. What a great experience! Great location - 5 minute walk to the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque in the heart of historical SultanAhmet. Great restaurants and shopping just outside the door. Exceptionally well appointed, spacious, comfortable room with all modern ameneties. The buffet breakfast was excellent - lots of variety! The service - EXCEPTIONAL! At the front desk, Lale' was superb - she was helpful, smiling, polite and always ready with a great complimentary cup of coffee or tea as we walked in after a long day of sightseeing! Would we stay there again - a very definite YES! Maria & Mansoor Naqi, Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “ExcellentÂ¨”
Reviews.Author: xnightshadow
Reviews.Content: Clean, tidy hotel with extremely nice hotel staff, good food service, namely this one receptionist Mehmet was extremely helpful and kind. Good english too. Recommend it highly for the stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “...exceptional customer service...”
Reviews.Author: D S
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Acra Hotel in istanbul, turkey have been bottom line outstanding. Very outgoing with strong focus on timely and high quality customer service. We felt pampered from the moment we stepped into the hotel. The rooms are clean, quiet, with a beautiful view of the Bosphorus. The hotel is in the center of the old town, just minutes away from st. Sophia and the blue mosque... Everything is walkable, and the kind folks at the acra hotel were more than happy to assist whenever we had questions and/or were in need of assistance/directions. TeÅŸekkÃ¼r ederim!!! Absolutely nothing to complain about... The trip was a blast. Kudos to the staff of the Acra Hotel... I will be recommending you to any/all people that are going to istanbul; whether for leisure of business... Customer service alone makes you feel like a sultan. Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful people. We are still under the strong impressions as the folks that work at the Acra Hotel, have been crucial in making this an unforgettable experience... Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to start your vacation in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Richlo
Reviews.Content: Acra is located in Sultanamet area with hundreds of similar-looking hotels. It seems to be a cut above the rest because of excellent service and very nice facilities. The room we had was relatively spacious for this type of hotel and the bathroom was very modern and comfortable. Only drawback was that the walls seemed paper-thin; we could hear the guest in the adjacent room loud and clear. The breakfast was excellent - especially the fine yoghurt, cheeses and honey. The service was very friendly; particularly the front desk. However, they always seemed to be steering me toward certain restaurants. Also, they did not know of any laundry facilities - I had to find that myself. But, overall, a very nice place to start our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elaine H
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just spent four nights at the Acra Hotel and it was among the best experiences we've ever had at a hotel, in large part because of its wonderful, friendly staff. The location is perfect- close to all of the major sights in Sultanahmet, and super close to restaurants and shopping, but not on a main drag so we had no problems with noise. The decor is sumptuous and luxurious, and everything is new, clean, and in good working condition. Our room was stunning, with two lovely Juliet balconies with views of the sea and the Blue Mosque. The breakfast room is an amazing two story space with tables set among excavated ruins. Unlike many of the hotels in the area, Acra only serves breakfast to its own guests (not open to the public), and doesn't have a full-service restaurant, which makes it much more quiet and pleasant to stay here. But the thing that really sets Acra apart is the amazing service. The staff was very knowledgable and wonderful about helping us decide what to do, booking tickets and appointments for us for performances, boat rides, and baths, making suggestions for restaurants and calling for reservations. This hotel really seems to have gotten the best of the best when it comes to staff- everyone we spoke to seemed like they really liked interacting with the hotel guests and were happy to help. Other nice amenities - the hotel offers a great breakfast included in the cost of the room, a complimentary car service pickup from the airport, puts out tea and cookies and fruit every afternoon, has free wireless internet in the rooms, and computers available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: LindaNZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, and so pleasantly quiet. Our room was excellent. Pretty much all the amenities we need, and enough space for the two of us, with two comfortable armchairs by the window, with a view up to the Blue mosque. Nice modern building, and a secret gem of a breakfast room with excavations from one of the ancient palaces which lay under the streets of Sultanahmet. The breakfast provided was fine. The usual line up of juices, coffee, tea, cereals, olives, cold meats and cheeses you find in Europe, and a small selection of hot dishes, Turkish style, some cakes and breads. Cooked eggs are provided but you won't find the egg stations you find in Asia. The fruit was divine though - fresh peaches and plums were a highlight. Complimentary water was not replenished after the first day, despite the notice in the bathroom that the water is not safe to drink. So this was a minor irritant - minor because water was easily available on the street, and very cheap. I'm sure if we'd remembered to ask, it would have been provided. The location couldn't be better. The hotel is on a very quiet street, only meters from a bustling street full of restaurants and bars, with souvenir shops, and at least two convenience stores where we could buy water or other supplies. Literally only a few minutes walk up the hill, and past the Arasta Bazaar, you find yourself standing between the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia. We walked through this area a lot, seeing the two buildings at different times of day and photographing in different lights. The tram stops there too, and is a cheap and convenient way to get to the new town if your feet give out after all the sightseeing. The staff helped us book a day trip to Gallipoli, and checking in and out was efficient. For a small tourist hotel it offers good quality at a very reasonable price in an excellent location. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to first-time visitors to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and comfortable hotel. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: loietil
Reviews.Content: Just completed 4-day stay. Superb and helpful staff. MesutÃ¶ Lale FatÄ±h and Mehmet helped us fÄ±nd restaurants...tours...transit...fÄ±x glasses...work computers. All good recommendatÄ±ons. Hotel room large and spotless...quiet air condÄ±tioning...amazing breakfasts. Cannot recommend hÄ±ghly enough. Perfect locatÄ±on. Close to sÄ±tes and transit.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling good at a hotel is the best way to start a trip!”
Reviews.Author: GraÃ§a C
Reviews.Content: Visiting Istanbul can be challenging if you are searching for a suitable hotel. ACRA hotel was a GREAT choice (thanks to the help of these reviews), so I decided to reinforce them: the staff is very welcoming and speak English, breakfast is varied and well served, all rooms are spotlessly clean and the front desk offers a great variety of excursions. Above all, it is very well located, 30m from Ataturk International airport and just 5m walking from some of the city's ex-libris, subway station and tram line. If you don't have the chance to shop at the Grand Bazaar, you can find beautiful souvenir shops nearby. Being close to Ayasofya and the Blue Mosque, allowed me to live the rituals and joy of Ramazan, thus experiencing the true turkish culture!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: csttoronto
Reviews.Content: My son (18) and I stayed at the Acra Hotel for two night upon arrival in Istanbul. It is very close to all the major sights and easily accessed from the airport. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms a good size and the buffet breakfast offered quality items and variety.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2ontheroadCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Istanbul where we spent 7 nights at Hotel Acra. We chose this hotel based on the good comments on TripAdvisor: generous size rooms and bathrooms, good location, attractive furnishings, friendly and helpful staff, especially Lale. Our room, #304, was especially comfortable because it was a corner room and had two large windows. A cool breeze blew through the room every afternoon and evening. We were told that all the rooms are the same size, but that superior double rooms are on the top two floors which is where ours was. In addition to all this, we chose Acra for the special room rate offered on the hotel website for early booking and multiple day stays. Transport from the airport was included. It's a great deal! At the end of each enjoyable day exploring Istanbul, it felt good to return to the comfort and friendly people of Hotel Acra.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near historic sights of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: StephenUden
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a family room for 5 (always hard to find) for two nights. Hotel staff were extremely helpful, room was nice and breakfast was excellent. Hotel was 5 minutes away from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia in an area with plenty of restaurants and cafes. Highly recommended for a stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it very much!”
Reviews.Author: kmdek
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, walking distance to all attractions and the tram station. Breakfast was great, can not say anything bad about this place. The staff were very helpful and advised us on where to go and how to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week for our honeymoon in Istanbul and stayed at the Acra Hotel. Not only was the location perfect for sightseeing, but the hotel staff were amazing. Lale greeted us at the front desk and made every bit of our stay hassle free and enjoyable. The entire staff was courteous and very helpful in helping us plan tours and various other tourist activities. Istanbul was an amazing city and my wife and I are already thinking of our next visit. We will surely be staying at this hotel and recommend this place to anyone reading this review.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: whx_epic
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, around 5 minutes from Blue Mosque. I booked a triple room from this hotel, but when I came, the receptionist instead offered me a family room for us without further charge. The staffs there are really friendly and courteous. The family room is spacious and the furniture etc is very beautiful. The only downside is that we stay at the basement and sometimes it is a bit loud in the night as our neighbour is a restaurant, but we are okay with that as the service and the rooms are exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Ezbez
Reviews.Content: This hotel had amazing service, people were polite and helpful. The rooms were a good size and were very comfortable. I did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Family room was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CGW
Reviews.Content: Other reviews cover the excellent location. We travelled with 2 children and stayed 4 nights in the Family room. The room had a seperate bedroom for the kids with a door. The kids room had a seperate TV and air conditioning unit. The other room has a king or queen size bed, TV, air conditioning and some tables and chairs. The bathroom was lovely and the room was well appointed. This is definately a 4 star hotel. The breakfast was plentify and served in the basement. I would certainly rate the room 5 (excellent). The only reason I rated the hotel overall a 4 was the attitude of one of the staff. Although most were friendly they lacked a genuiness we found in other smaller hotels. One woman was very unhelpful. Due to a mix up with dates we ended up spending 1 night a Hotel Sari Konak. It is a stones throw away. We stayed in a suite at Hotel Sari Konak which was very nice but the room could not compare to Acra. The Hotel Sari Konak had the advantage of a fabulous roof top terrace with great views of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. The breakfast food is fine but not as good as Acra however. We enjoyed our stay in Istanbul but were disappinted with the food. Definately worth going to Bar 360. We took the shorter boat trip on the Bosphorous. It does not go as far but takes about 2 hours and goes at a nice slow pace near the shore, allowing you to better to see the sights rather than zig zag up the Bosphorous (which the main ferry does). We used the tram regularly and found the Akbil tag useful and cheaper. You can get Akbil at little booth/shops near the tram stops. You do not need 1 each- just swip it once for each person. We paid 160 Euro per night for the family room for 4 in July.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect hotel, with the best location”
Reviews.Author: Stathis44
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife,we stayed at the Acra hotel for 5 days, from 18/07/2011 to 23/07/2011.Hotel facilities were perfect,room was clean and spacious.It was a superior double room with view to Hagia Sophia.The hotel is 5 minutes walk from most of city's sightseeings.Hotel staff was friendly and the breakfast was superb.Definitely, I will recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Sultanahmet!”
Reviews.Author: offshore8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during a stopover and first visit to Istanbul on our way back from India to Canada. This was a great small hotel that we would happily stay at again! Pickup from the airport arranged by the hotel was smooth. On arrival, we were very warmly greeted and welcomed by Lale and the other staff. Lale was present throughout our stay and was so friendly and wonderful to deal with - she is great! She also arranged a headache-free full refund on a city tour that did not go very well (not the hotel's fault). Rooms are very nice. Average size for what is expected in Europe. Nice beds, nicely appointed, very clean and modern bathrooms. Awesome breakfast downstairs included in rate. Nice evening snacks. Great location in Sultanahmet if this is where you want to stay. The area is very touristy but is perfect for a first visit to Istanbul. Only negative would be that the walls are very thin, but that didn't bother me. You will have no problems staying here. Very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: elzaina1
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best boutique hotels in the area, it a 2 min. walk to every where in the old city, a cozy place you will always feel like home. Wonderful hospitable staff how will do any thing to make your stay comfortable. We had a lovely time there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Char-02
Reviews.Content: Hotel Acra is well-located and very clean. A very nice mid-range hotel and a good value. Also, Lale was very helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: oschmidt28
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Acra for three nights in June. The hotel is very centrally located for all the main tourist attractions in Sultanahmet. The staff was very friendly and the hotel itself was nice, however, it did lack some of the amenities that could have improved the overall experience. There was no hotel restaurant (although they do serve breakfast in the basement floor) and there was no roofdeck that many of the other local hotels have. Although the staff were very friendly and happy to provide recommendations, we found that this was more of an arrangement with the local restaurants and less of a true endorsement. There is a really nice seafood restaurant directly below the hotel, but we had to stumble on this ourselves. Also, we decided to arrange a guided tour with She Tours over the other tour companies on the recommendation of the staff. Given how close all the major attractions are in Sultanahmet, we would have been much better off with a walking tour (and saved some money). When we asked for the recommendation it would have been nice to mention this, but this is partially our fault for not doing more homework. Overall we found Acra to be a good value and a great location, but thought there could be a few improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: portmagpie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Acra Hotel for 3 nights and found this hotel to be very comfortable in a nice area of the old town very close the Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Underground Cisterns, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. We had a large comfortable room and enjoyed the basement breakfast area built into the foundations of the hotel. There are many restaurants in the area with reasonable prices and we would recommend this hotel as being very good value. The service was excellent and their was free wi fi internet.

Reviews.Title: “Really good”
Reviews.Author: MIdastouch
Reviews.Content: Everything people say about this place is true. We stayed 5 nights in a superior room - worth the small extra cost if you are staying more than a couple of nights. We qualified for the free airport pick up and this was a really convenient, stress-free way to arrive at the city. We also used and paid for the service on return at a cost of 30 euro which while slightly dearer than a regular taxi it was again convenient, prompt and courteous. The staff are extremely helpful (they help print our boarding passes for our return flights using their free computer/wi-fi). The breakfast is comprehensive and location is perfect - just 5 mins from the middle of the action. All in all a very good value, clean, safe and friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Acra Hotel and its staff”
Reviews.Author: katsano
Reviews.Content: We were at the Acra for a few days in Decemer, went to Cappadoccia and returned for a few more days. Our room was comfortable and clean. The staff were wonderfu l - from Lale, Mesut and Hasan at the desk to Con in the breakfast room. The were very helpful in making reommendations for places to eat and how to get around. They held our extra luggage when we went to Cappadoccia. The basement breakfast room is large but cozy. Food was good. Bread fresh. Tea and pastries were available when we arrived back fro our time exploring the city. We met some very nice people who were also staying there. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “â€œExcellent Staff, Great Location!â€�”
Reviews.Author: ashirin
Reviews.Content: I was well impressed by the standard of service and especially staff. They were very welcoming and helpful-Masud was particularly helpful.thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great rooms and central location”
Reviews.Author: EntebbeEastafrican
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a stop off, just to relax for a couple of nights. We wish we had stayed longer. We arrived early, at 830am - the hotel had organised our airport collection in a comfortable air/con mini bus. When we arrived we were offered breakfast at no charge and an early check in room was ready for us. Lale at the front desk orgainsed a boat trip for us and gave us information about what to see, where to change money, etc. Ozlem at reservations had been helpful all along as our booking dates changed twice before we arrived. Porters could not be more helpful, showing us the internet area, carrying bags and generally just being gracious. The hotel is central to everything that we did, the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Aya Sophia, the covered Bazaar, Cistern basilica, shops, Mesale cafe for the dervish display. We walked everywhere although it is easy to get the hop on hop off buses close by if you want to venture further. Our room had excellent air con, a lovely bathroom, with good quality toiletries, towels and shower and bath, There was TV in the room, safe, fridge, free internet, a little balcony, all delightful and very elegant. We loved Istanbul and plan to come back and stop over on our way home again - friends had suggested a few hotels in the area so we checked them out, but we will only stay at the Acra- with the airport transfers taken care of, and transport to the boat trips it was a real pleasure plus we felt very safe there. The staff are a credit to the hotel and the hotel is great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: rebmax
Reviews.Content: I must agree with the other reviewers. This is an excellent hotel. A 4 1/2 if I could figure out how to mark 1/2. It is modern and clean, and I would include that it has lovely elegant touches (chandeliers for instance) without bein over whelming or stuffy.The bathrooms are great- marble and modern- good lighting and water pressure. The beds and bed linens are very good and comfortable. The rooms are nicely done (somewhat small but not really by European standards) with lovely touches including ,molding, built in wooden clsets, antique type lamps. Our room also had a balcony (looking up to Aya Sophia and across the water at the Bosphorous, which we loved) and two chairs, which is always nicer than always having to sit on the bed. It may not have all the old fashioned charm of say Yesil Ev, but it is a great and lovely refuge in a very busy and noisy city. (Windows very good and double glazed-keeping out much of the noise of the streets.) The breakfast was also excellent, the usual with fresh bread, yogurts, cheeses, eggs, juice etc. Breakfast is served in a charming partially below grade basement, but it was bright, cheerful and charming nonetheless- with light streaming in from the window wells. But the show stopped in the basement was the old stone walls, which were the outside foundation of the old palace. I must also comment on the staff- very friendly and welcoming and very helpful. Thank you all. The location couldn't be better-one block from "restaurant row" in Sultanamet, 2 1/2 blocks from the Arasta Market (Much more enjoyable than the Grand Bazaar), 3 blocks from the Blue Mosque and the Hippodrome .Really a very short walk to all of the top sites in Istanbul. We couldn't have been happier with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: swilly2000
Reviews.Content: Really one of the best hotels I ever stayed in my life. Big rooms, ideal location very close to the Blue Mosque and at the same time at the quiet street, very helpful staff. Good bathroom with all necessary equipment. I would definitely come beck to this hotel when I am in Istanbul the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mopsik
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous trip to Istanbul. Stayed at the Acra. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Lale at the front desk. Room was comfortable and clean with a view of the Hagia Sophia Mosque. Hotel is very close to all major historical sites yet is situated on a quiet street. Breakfast was included in our room fee and was extensive - from sweet to savory and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: fgr005
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of Ayasofia, the Blue Mosque, Imperial Cisterns, Topkapi Palace, the Grand Bazaar et al. It is also close to the tram line with easy access to other parts of the city. The room was tastefully appointed and clean. The breakfast was plentiful and sumptuous while afternoon tea offered a welcome respite from a busy day of sightseeing. The staff were friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. Would not hesitate to recommend this charming place. The Russo's-USA

Reviews.Title: “Delightful small hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: tobywasp
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and found the Acra a delightful small hotel conveniently situated for all the major sights. The rooms were really comfortable and tastefully furnished, we had a good view from ours on the seconf floor and despite being in a very busy city the location was quiet. Breakfast was excellent and made all the more interesting being set amongst ancient ruins. Complimentary tea and pastries were very welcome after a days sightseeing. All in all a great choice for a stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “An Ideal Location in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: ulysses4
Reviews.Content: We are always looking for small hotels with character, charm and reasonable value. In a big and intense city, it also helps if the hotel is relatively quiet. There are so many hotels to choose from in Istanbul, and most are quite small. We spent a lot of time looking at TA and other references before selecting the Acra. We chose well. With a one week stay, we certainly began to feel this was our home in Istanbul. Sultanahmet is at the core of the majority of things a tourist will want to see. It also has its share of tourist trap stores and restaurants. Mesut, and other staff members will help navigate you to better choices. This is a fine quality hotel, but not extravagant. The public areas and rooms are tastefully decorated and there is a high standard of cleanliness and service. Mesut, at the front desk, was also our concierge, and performed that function as skillfully as one would find at a much fancier hotel. On some of our bus tours in the city, we were driven past many of the other hotels we had considered. Acra is in a remarkably quiet little corner just a short distance from much of the intense commercial action. Tram, taxi and bus transport are all readily available, although walking is the most enjoyable way to get to know the city. There was a genuine feeling of hospitality at the hotel and we wouldn't hesitate to return on another trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “a modern classic”
Reviews.Author: sallymitani
Reviews.Content: This new boutique hotel is also about as ancient as you can get--in the basement breakfast room, you can see the remains of Emperor Constantin's palace. Staff is great--Lale was particularly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in heart of sultanamhet”
Reviews.Author: 187791Mark
Reviews.Content: An excellent and cosy hotel in the heart of the old town. Staff always helpful to help out and advise. Mark

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ia2k
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in March. Rooms look absolutely amazing - nice decorum, put a lot of detail into the room! The staff is extremely friendly, giving you information about the city and attractions upon arrival, as well as a welcome drink. Location is perfect, just a 2 minute walk to Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque and tram - hotel is situated on lovely street. Plenty of places to eat nearby. Mahmood and the other staff always greeted us genuinely when leaving and entering the hotel. The afternoon snacks were a delight in the lobby! Definitely will stay here again if I come back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Focus on friendly personal attention, luxury boutique hotel within walking distance of key attractions”
Reviews.Author: bramm_travel
Reviews.Content: Staff ensure that your sightseeing and restaurant needs are well catered for and provide good advise on where to go and how to get there. Rooms are comfortable and very clean. Breakfast is more than adequate. Complimentary Turkish tea, coffee and cakes in lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Bravi bravissimi...Giorgio & Angelika from athens”
Reviews.Author: GIORGIO189400
Reviews.Content: i would like to say a big than you to all the staff of acra hotel !! especialy to lele and misut of the reception!!! Instambul is fantastic and it has to be your next trip!! alone or with your children, but better a romantic trip alone !!!! :))))))) good easter to all of you Giorgio & Angelika

Reviews.Title: “Super freundliches und hilfsbereites Personal, beste Lage”
Reviews.Author: bricarlene
Reviews.Content: Mitten im Zentrum der Altstadt gelegen, nahe an vielen Restaurants und den wichtigsten SehenswÃ¼rdigkeiten. Stadtrundfahrten werden vom hilfsbereiten und freundlichen Personal organisiert und starten direkt beim Hotel. Wunderbar der Empfangsraum mit gratis Tee und Kuchen am Nachmittag. Etwas dÃ¼nne WÃ¤nde zwischen den ansonsten sehr geschmackvollen und sauberen Zimmern. Der FrÃ¼hstÃ¼cksraum mit alten Mauerresten mit speziellem Flair, das FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck selber nicht umwerfend.

Reviews.Title: “Toplocation and friendly and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Billyqueenie
Reviews.Content: Great location, good price/value, breakfast basic but OK, superfriendly staff and very helpfull. Next to a lot of Restaurants and only 5 minutes walk from Topkapi and Blue Mosk. Situated in a quiet neighborhood with practically no trafic ! The only mistake they made was with the bill. My travelagent paid my hotel op 04-04-2011 and we stayed in the hotel from 04-11-2011 until 04-16-2011 and they made me pay with my creditcard before I left ! So I am still waiting for a return of funds for 940 â‚¬

Reviews.Title: “Culture vulture's dream location”
Reviews.Author: TheHayes
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location of this hotel in the heart of the old historic ruins of Istanbul. Just minutes walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Topkapi Palace and plenty of restaurants and bars in the area too. Fantastic staff who were always polite, helpful and efficient. Many thanks to the wonderful receptionists who helped us during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: bobym
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Acra hotel for 6 days from the end of March until the 5th of April. The location of the hotel is perfect, in the old town close to all the important landmarks. The rooms are clean. The staff is very nice and smiling, especially the recepsionist- Lale, she was very kind and helpful, whenever we asked about something we doubted to visit in the city, she gave us the right information- that was very helpful and useful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: easygoinggirl1992
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in March 2011. Not only a fantastic location but a wonderful hotel, staff were so friendly and welcoming and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was also delicious, a huge spread of different Turkish breakfast foods as well as toast and cereals for those who are a bit less adventurous. I would highly reccomend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with the best service in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Wellington_Alves
Reviews.Content: Acra hotel was probably the best surprise of Istanbul. Not only because its perfect location (5 min walking to Blue Mosque), but also because of its "modern meets antique" style and atmosphere, combined with the perfect service they offer. Sincerely, we only found this kind of service at the best 5-star hotels around the world! Not to mention the great breakfast and high speed wi-fi internet throughout the whole hotel. Definetely gonna recomend to everyone when visiting Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “A fine choice”
Reviews.Author: Mayoabu
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed here for a 3 night city break. We could hardly have made a better choice. The location is excellent, being a short walk from many of Istanbul's best known sites. There is a good choice of restaurants, literally within 2 minutes walk. We took superior rooms and found them perfectly adequate. Good power showers, small baths. Decent sized, though not huge. There was a reasonable choice for breakfast which was included in our rate. The reception staff were most obliging, pleased to help and able to make useful recommendations. All in all an excellent stay at this pleasing hotel in a fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: helengold
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week in the Acra, a lovely small hotel in a great location in Sultanahmet, perfect location for all the main attractions, the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, etc. The staff were so friendly and welcoming and always very helpful, even stopping for a chat to see how we were doing and how our day was going when we bumped into one of them on their day off. The rooms were comfortable and clean and nicely decorated. The breakfast room is set amongst the remains of the Great Palace, wonderfully atomospheric, and again the waiter could not be more helpful and always cheerful. They offer a lovely complimentary fabulous spread of afternoon tea, which was particularly welcoming after the long journey when we arrived, and after a days sight seeing. We had a great stay and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed Service”
Reviews.Author: Stoatin
Reviews.Content: Read excellent reports from Trip Advisor before choosing this hotel. The hotel is situated in a reasonably quiet area but within easy access to good restaurants and shops. It is also served by an excellent taxi service practically on the doorstep. A 15 minute stroll through markets and past shops and restaurants will bring you to the Blue Mosque from where you are at the heart of the Tourist area. The hotel itself is clean and tidy and the welcome was customer service at its very best. Tea, coffee plus light refreshments were offered on arrival. Also this offering was available every day and much appreciated after a daily 'wander' round the streets of the city. Our bags were whisked away and we were immediately put at ease. Nothing was too much bother for the staff and that level of service not only continued but escalated during our stay. Restaurant recommendations were given when asked whether near or far. The two we experienced were close at hand (5 minute walk) and both excellent quality with great service. Our rooms were clean and tidy and fresh towels were supplied daily. The breakfast area has to be seen as it is built within a historical setting but very modern in experience. However our lasting memory of our 2nd visit to Istanbul apart from the the usual sites and culture will be the Acra Hotel's service to us as customers. They just could not do enough to ensure our stay was all we had hoped...care, kindness and customer service at its finest.. First Class hospitality. Thank you all and in the words of 'Arnie' 'I'll be back!' Oh did I mention there was also 24 x 7 free wi-fi for all guests in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Mediocre Room - Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: legendx
Reviews.Content: Location is the only reason you would go here (although it was very difficult to find the first time). The room and building are quite ordinary. I've stayed at more luxurious 3 star hotels. Breakfast was pretty minimal. Service was horrible. The service girl gave me attitude serveral times. When I asked why there's no tissue box in the room (I had a cold and it was very inconvenient) she said there's a store nearby where I can buy some if I need it. Wouldn't go there again; I don't care how good the location is...

Reviews.Title: “Best combination of location/value for Historic part of city”
Reviews.Author: Avalon1270
Reviews.Content: Five night stay in mid March 2011. Excellent location -- withing three blocks of the Blue Mosque and the Arasta market ( best value market in the city). the queen bed room was comfortable, very clean and very modern. Bath was better than most American large chain hotels we have stayed in. The lobby was clean, inviting and had free internet service along with complimentary tea/coffee/ pastries every afternoon. Breakfast included in the price had enough variety everyday to make us not look elsewhere. Staff was very friendly; interested in our activities and ah helpful suggestions. The staff English was exceptional. We particularly appreciated the help that Laka Kayhan gave us. If your interest is the old part of Istanbul, this location cannot be beat. Close to everything!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Andy48Wirral
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at The Acra on the basis of posotive reports on Trip Advisor. The hotel is superbly located for all the major sites , proberbly the best in the area. On check in you are met by a very hospitable management and reception team , who`s prime concern is that you enjoy your stay. We had reserved a Superior Room as we wanted more space but were allocated a room with three beds which we found to be rather cramped.The housekeeping is spotless and not intrusive. Breakfast was served in a spacious dining area and was adequate for a city break. Many good restaurants surround the area( we liked Rammi the most). The only negative point for consideration is , that due to our room being close to reception is that we found the hotel noisy and that you can hear other rooms. I would advise choosing rooms away from this area of the hotel. We would definatly stay here again if we returned to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: Mstislav
Reviews.Content: I really love to travel with comfort and having spent in ACRA hotel 4 nights I can say that the hotel is one of the best I have ever visited, because I found there much more than I expected while booking it. The room was big, tastefully furnished, always clean, fresh, quiet and I had there all I needed. But what was the most impressive is that staff seems could always predict my need before I could feel it myself â€“ very high level of hospitality. And I would like to say special thanks to Lale, Mesut, Oguz and other guys who did their best for I could feel myself being at home and even better. Very good situated ACRA is highly recommended to ones who has just a few days to see all.

Reviews.Title: “â€œFantastic location and friendly staffâ€�”
Reviews.Author: Amenti
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! My partner and I stayed 7 nights at the hotel (6-13 march). Everything was good. Nice rooms, helpfull and very friendly staff !!! Great location in the Sultanahmet district in the old city! I would like to recommend Acra hotel for my friends. Irina

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: SabinaU
Reviews.Content: Very nice stuff!!! special thanks to Mesut, Lale and Oguz. Rooms: clean, cozy, but smaller than presented in the photos. Location: near to all historical places Public transport: tramway stop - 5 min, train stop - 7 min, seabus - 10 min

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff service- one of the best I have ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: Aireenmiah
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, it is in the perfect location to visit all the nearest attractions and is also close to the metro service. The best part of the hotel was the staff, all of which were extremely helpful in finding places to go, directions as well as having all the local knowledge. The staff were all friendly and helpful especially mesut and Lale can fatih. There is wifi connection as well as breakfast and tea in the afternoon, overall an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and good location”
Reviews.Author: Traveladdict1978
Reviews.Content: I just visited Acra Hotel in Istanbul. On arriving at the hotel the receptionist was very helpful asking me if I had plans and making suggestions of places to visit. She also upgraded us from a standard to a superior room. The porter showed us where everything was in our room and was also very helpful. The decor of the room was better than I expected and very clean. The buffet breakfast offered a good choice of local and western food and was served until 10:30am. This hotel is great if you want to be near the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque and has some good restaurants nearby. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and great stuff!”
Reviews.Author: ibtissem1980
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our holidays time in Istanbul, it was a wonderful moments. Acra hotel was a very good choice, a very special location in sultanahmet area, beautiful and very clean rooms, delicious breakfast, internet access,free tea and coffee service in rooms. Spacious bedroom with very comfortable bed, with central heating, air conditioning, tv etc... The bathroom very clean and comfortable. We were very satisfied!!!! A very friendly and helpful stuff specially Mesut ! We want also to thanks Fatih and Lili!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent value and great staff!!Great place to stay:)”
Reviews.Author: Winter010
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with Acra Hotel! Good choice! Location in the old city near everything, staff very fiendly, breakfast exellent, room spasious and always clean, not noisy; you even could sleep with open windows, free internet... Nothing bad!

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: andrew1947
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Acra Hotel for 6 nights [>4 nights gets you a free airport pickup] and it was a delightful stay for a host of reasons: superb rooms [ask for one with a view if available] and genuinely helpful/friendly staff {Lale-Can-Fatih}. Included in the price were the following: a huge breakfast, internet access and just when you have walked all day and are ready to drop, there is a wonderful English-style â€˜high-teaâ€™ service every afternoon. A major plus of Acra is the location in Sultanahmet which means virtually all the major historic sights are within a 15-min walk from the hotel. What cannot be walked is a tram ride away and the tram-stop, as well as well known eating spots, major ATM sites, official Turkish Tourism information office etc are a stoneâ€™s throw away. In summary, the Acra Hotel is a Turkish gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Magriet03
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Acra hotel and are very satisfied. Everything was good. the people where very friendly and the service was excellent. They have made our time in Instanbul very relaxed and comfortable. You will not regret booking this hotel. Cees Kamp and Margriet van Tilburg

Reviews.Title: “Definitely best value after we checked over 10 hotels in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bonjourahui
Reviews.Content: When we booked online before our arrival in Istanbul, for safety reasons we booked a brand name hotel a bit over our budget of 100 Euros per night. That hotel is a disappointment. Nothing wrong with it - just not worth the money. So we checked out over 10 hotels in Sultanhamet, and found Acra to be the best value without a doubt. We saw places ranging from 50 euros (a disaster) to over 100 euros. And those 100 euro rooms are just as good as Acra's. So Acra is a steal for its price (look harder and you might find even better deals). We ended up staying for 6 nights in this hotel and the room is great, daily cleaning is great, service is friendly and all things are good. One bit of disappointment is its breakfast. Nothing warm, no eggs/sausages cooked upon request, pretty small selection in a rather cold room on the ground floor. If Acra can improve its breakfast, then it is the best value hotel in Sultanhamet.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great ! :)”
Reviews.Author: KeityNi
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was located next to all those monuments we were planning to visit , as well as the 2 markets ( capali carsi and the spice market ) . I loved the fact that the the neighbourhood was like old Istanbul , insted of living in the town with busy shops and crowd! I would also like to note that the staff of the Hotel was very helpful and friendly to us, which made us feel more at home rather than in a hotel ! I would also to state that Lale and Fatih ( at the reception desk ) were very helpful and polite, who made our trip more easier with their advices ( as it was our first time in Istanbul ). The hotel was also very clean and the breakfast very tasty ! ( Do not forget when visiting to eat the Tiramisu ) !! :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Modern Lodging in the Old Town of Sultanahmet with Amazing Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Zio6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (who are both in the hotel business) stayed at the Acra the week of January 10 and had a wonderful experience at this great hotel. The property has a boutique like feel to it and the staff wend over and above in order to make our first trip to Istanbul a memorable one. From the front desk to the concierge to the cleaning staff, everyone was friendly and accommodating, which made this trip worth every penny and I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again on our next visit. We had an issue when a front desk agent recommended a show & dinner on the Asian side of Istanbul to us at a quoted rate, which would include pick up and drop off at our hotel (we specifically asked if the show, called Istanbulin, would accept a credit card so we would not have to take out cash, and the front desk agent said of course). Upon getting the bill at Istanbulin and attempting to pay with a credit card, the manager there informed us that there would be a 18% tax added to our bill and that the price our hotel had quoted us was a "cash price". Needless to say, I informed Mesut at the hotel the following day of what had happened, and he immediately paid me the 18% difference and removed all of the fliers for that particular show from the front desk. He promptly apologized and said they would no longer refer guests to Istanbulin, accepting full responsibility. Due to this high level of customer service and honesty, I will absolutely return to Istanbul and plan on staying at Acra on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to be recommended”
Reviews.Author: azhar9595
Reviews.Content: Clean and staffs very friendly. Close to historical sites at sultanahmet and restaurants. Got complimentary transfer too. It's value for money hotel. We like the free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have stayed at in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: jewels098
