Reviews.Content: The Acra Hotel is set in the Sultanhamet area of Istanbul and it's a real diamond. The hotel is approximately 2 years old and the staff are extremely helpful. Our bedroom was spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable and the decor of the room very nice with central heating, air conditioning, tv, fridge, etc. The bathroom was also very smart and kept very clean by the staff. Breakfast was plentiful and enjoyed. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the famous sites of Istanbul, i.e. Blue Mosque, etc. This is our third visit to Istanbul and it's the best hotel I have stayed in in this city. We will certainly return to this hotel next year and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: GothKing
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, attentive staff, steps away from all the major cultural attractions in Istanbul (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Justinian's cistern, Topkapi palace). Breakfast buffet is well stocked and the floorspace actually accomodates the ruins of an ancient Byzantine palace.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great location, did I mention wonderful service?”
Reviews.Author: OMrgn
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel experience. Friendly and very helpful service. Wonderful staff, ever so helpful and very pleasing. Hotel has a great atmosphere. Rooms and toilets were clean and sparkling. Very close to tourist attractions, 5 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque. Great place. Would definitely recommend it to anyone and everyone! Special thanks to Leila who helped us a lot through out the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: ECB7
Reviews.Content: Great location in the Sultanahmet district in the old city. The hotel is very clean and the staff is very helpful. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: henryjf
Reviews.Content: The Acra is an excellent choice among the many small hotels in a prime tourist area. Many of the major sites are within easy walking distance. The room was very clean, reasonably spacious, and well maintained. Breakfast was first-rate. Excellent staff: courteous to the extreme and attended to all our needs. Here's a photo of Mesut who promises to change the wall clock to read Kansas City time. We'll stay here again should we journey to Istanbul once more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff&Place”
Reviews.Author: K.Y-4438
Reviews.Content: * All the staff was very kind. they had my children love very much. * In particular, we thank Mr. Mesut of the front desk, because he was nice to us all the time. * The geographical convenience of the hotel is splendid. There is a hotel in the immediate place on foot in a tourist facility of the old town. The atmosphere around the hotel is good, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: fresca82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at acra with my fiancÃ© for a week. It was our first trip to Istanbul and I'm so glad we stayed here. It's located down a quiet street next to some other small hotels, but only a quick walk to the blue mosque, Hagia Sophia, and many restaurants. The room we stayed in was a nice corner room with views of the water out one window and charming buildings out the other. The decor was very nice... Beautiful carved wood furniture, Turkish carpets, and pretty drapes. It was traditional, but not outdated. The bathroom was beautiful with a large marble vanity and really nice stall shower. Housekeeping did a great job everyday at tidying up our room. The entire hotel was kept very clean. The staff were exceptionally friendly and professional. There was always someone at the front desk greeting us and ready to help with restaurant recommendations or to answer any questions we had. Breakfast on the lower level was very nice. It was a buffet with a large variety of food to choose from including different fruit preserves, honeys, cheeses, and meats. The girls working in the kitchen were happy to prepare omelets for us if there were no eggs left. To sum things up I would be very pleased to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gold standard for hospitality”
Reviews.Author: janellebug
Reviews.Content: I stayed at two hotels during my stay in Istanbul and couldn't be more pleased with my stay at the Acra Hotel. I've stayed at many hotels worldwide, but none can top the Acra when it comes to the hospitality of their staff. From the very start, Lale welcomed us and helped us out of a difficult situation as the cab driver tried to overcharge us (we asked to make sure he had a meter, but it turns out it was broken). She, along with Mesut and Fotih, made us feel like a guest in their own home, and attended to every need, even anticipating needs that we hadn't thought of yet. I am so glad that I found the Acra Hotel; the rooms, the location, and most importantly, the staff, made my trip in Istanbul. The Acra Hotel is now the gold standard when it comes to hotel service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great staff and location.”
Reviews.Author: Jannat_Kaz
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great within walking distance to the historical places of Sultanahmet area (Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Topkapi Palace). Cozy room with very good designed furniture. All the staff were excellent, friendly and helpful giving advice on things to do and see. I would like to recommend Acra hotel to anyone and whenever I'm back in Istanbul would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Heron5
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Istanbul by ourselves and were greeted by the friendliest concierge Hasan. He gave us the best advice about the availability of the tours available to get a great insight into the wonderful city of Istanbul He recommended restaurants and we only erred when we did not follow his advice..... The hotel Acra is extremely well situated, with the Aya Sophia, a wonderful art center, restaurants and even a small bazaar within walking distance. They offer a very nice daily breakfast in a large room built among ruins. They also serve snacks in the afternoon in the foyer of the hotel. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGreggs
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Acra Hotel. Location was perfect, just a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque & about 20 min walk to the Grand Bazaar. Staff was friendly, helpful and English speaking. The hotel offered a computer with internet in lobby for free, free WiFi, tasty afternoon tea and snacks, free breakfast with a good variety, airport transfers and clean, comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: skripal
Reviews.Content: Very cozy and comfortable hotel. An ideal arrangement. The sympathetic and affable personnel. Tasty breakfasts. Numbers are equipped by an electric kettle. To all visitors a bottle of wine and fruit in a gift. Transfer services. We are very happy, and necessarily we will arrive again to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: AhmadKutty
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Acra hotel with my wife on November 25, 2010. We were booked for two days, but we missed one day because of a mix up in the flight schedule. Our stay at the hotel was pleasant; it was mainly due to the willingness of the hotel managers Mr. Hasan and Ms. Lala to go out of their way to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay if you want to be in Sultan Ahmet area”
Reviews.Author: tkrystock
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, reasonably priced, great location. Very friendly, helpful staff. Good clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for a long weekend in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeReviewer19
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights at the Acra and really liked the hotel from lots of points of view. The size and quality of the rooms and fittings are great, the staff are really friendly and helpful, the breakfast was good and the room in which the breakfast is served is really interesting. Its also in a great location within easy walking distance of lots of nice restaurants in the atmospheric nearby cobbled backstreets, key sights (Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazzar, Basilica Cistern, Hammams), and not far from a tram stop by Aya Sophia on a busy (good for shopping) main street from where you can travel all over the city (for a mere 1.75 TL).

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in a great area!”
Reviews.Author: pk20815
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend in early November. From the moment we walked into the hotel and were greeted by Hasan, we felt that we were treated like royalty. He offered us tea and cake and sat with us to explain about the various attractions in Instanbul. He and the other staff were alway helpful in locating and recommending restaurants, activities, etc. Our room was very comfortable. the bathroom was beautiful and it was always spotless. The breakfast offered an enormous amount of choices and was very good. I would definitely stay there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Incredible Location”
Reviews.Author: MJBaig
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at Acra Hotel for 7 nights. We had an enjoyable stay and the hotel is fantastic, well above our expectations. The hotel offers complimentary shuttle service to pick you up from the airport upon your arrival. Just make sure to email them your itinerary 24 hours in advance and arrange for pick up. The driver was at the airport already when we came out of customs and immediately had us in the car and on our way to the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted with smiles by Hasan. It was tea time in the afternoon, and at the hotel lobby they had a spread of snacks and rolls with delicious flavors of Turkish tea and coffee for all guests that we were able to enjoy. We had reserved a Superior Double Room, and we were given a room on the top - 4th floor. Although the immediate view was of other buildings and hotels, we had a partial sea view of the Bosphorus. The room itself was immaculate. Very clean, new, spacious, well decorated and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was super clean, in excellent condition and the shower was amazing. Coffee/Tea maker, hair dryer, and basic toiletries such as shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap were all provided in the room even though we had brought our own. The rooms do not have an iron, and you need to call the front desk to "loan" you one for use, which they take back when another room requests for it. The room had free Wi-Fi which made it easy to stay connected and check your email and stuff. The room also had a thermostat to control heating and cooling so you can set the temperature of your room which was great and a mini bar/fridge. The housekeeping staff is amazing as well. They went out of their way every day to keep the room tidy and did a great job. As others have mentioned, the hotel provided complimentary breakfast buffet every mooring on the ground floor. It was a decent spread of eggs, crepes, sausages, cheeses, home made jams, rolls, breads, cereals. It was great to get you going and energized for the day without having to wander out on the streets every morning searching for a breakfast place. Location, location, location - the hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of all the major Old City sites - Blue Mosque, Agia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Arasta Bazaar, Grand Bazaar, Sultanahmet Tram station, Bascilica Cistern and some amazing restaurants, cafes and pubs. Taksim Square was about a 10 minute ride away and costs around 15 Lira to get to. Spice Bazaar/Sulemanye Mosque were about the same. We were recommended by Hasan to try the Turquoise Restaurant on our first night and the food was great there. I would also recommend having some tea/snacks along with a Hookah/Water Pipe at Cafe Mesale and enjoying seeing a free Dervish dance there with live Turkish music from 8:00 PM - 10:00 PM. Its a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Last but not least, is to mention the hotel staff. Hasan, Lale, Mehmet, Oguz (Oz), Mesut were all very helpful and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable and helped us with our day to day planning and make recommendations. Kudos and cheers to all you guys. We plan on returning soon and would recommend Acra to our friends and families as a great place to stay when visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “SENSATIONAL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: fitzfloyd
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel the Acra is. It deserves its ranking on TripAdvisor. We stayed for five nights at the end of our travels in Turkey. We had an elegantly decorated room with a clean, fresh bathroom and plenty of hot water. There was a computer available in the reception area for the use of guests, as well as complimentary tea and cake in the afternoons. It was nice sitting in the comfortable leather chairs planning our next day's travels. The dining room in the basement is elegant and spacious and some two stories high, with the remnants of a Roman foundation in the centre. Quite fantastic - walking around the ancient ruin on the way to my muesli. The hotel is wonderful value and I definitely would like to stay there again: Istanbul has become my favorite city in the whole world! We stayed at a similar grade hotel in Sultanahmet when we first arrived on our holiday and while it too was lovely, it was much more expensive than the Acra. The Acra is great value. You won't need to catch taxis if you stay in Sultanahmet as many of the major sites are nearby. For those which are not, it's easy to catch the nearby tram, or use one of the public ferries on the Bosphorus or Sea of Mamara. I felt very safe in Istanbul and found the locals very helpful when I needed advice. Just write down the name of the place you want to find, and you'll have locals helping you.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: FabioAlves
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent six nights at Acra Hotel. The hotel is fantastic: fine architecture (the ruins at the restaurant are impressive), comfortable, well decorated rooms, delicious breakfast, excellent location, and, above all, very hospitable staff. We were welcomed at the hotel by Hasan with some delicious Turkish tea and sat on a comfotable couch while hearing the attentive explanations and useful tips on touring Istanbul. The rooms are clean, spacious, and comfortable. Location is fantastic - just two or three minutes away from the Hippodrome, Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque; good restaurants are just around the corner. Some things could be improved, though: my wife and I missed a 24-hour room service, and the hotel is a little bit noisy (we could hear people working in the kitchen early in the morning). A very good experience in an outstanding city, Acra Hotel is surely to be recommeded without faltering!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and warm”
Reviews.Author: MariaKrelli
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service and rooms, don't hesitate to ask all receptionists to help you, they will be glad to give you any information you may need!Special thanks to the assistant of Ms. Ozlem and Mr. Hasan and to all receptionists!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jane3A12
Reviews.Content: Istanbul was our last European/Asian stop at the end of a fantastic holiday.We chose Acra on Booking . com because of the location and reviews we had read.We were not disappointed.The hotel was well located and the staff were amazing.They recommended two great restaurants and also gave good advice on daytrips , sights etc.I would be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Istanbul.They also have a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Istanbul accomodation”
Reviews.Author: AriArt
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our time in Istanbul and staying in this hotel. The staff has been really friendly and helpful. Great postion for the main attractions. We'll definetely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erik600
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with Hotel Acra. The double room was spacious and it was well cleaned every day. Breakfast is good and the hotels free serving of tea, cakes and fruits during the day was a nice surprise. The location is perfect, close to the main attractions but not too close to any noisy restaurants. The lobby personnel is very friendly and helpful and makes the stay in Acra most pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Visited for business but will return for pleasure!!”
Reviews.Author: lisa5380
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Istanbul at the beginning of November for a short 2 day business meeting. I was traveling alone and so wanted a nice hotel within walking distance of the main sights in the Old City, I found the Acra thanks to Trip Advisor and wasn't disappointed. The staff are so friendly, welcoming and helpful, they are worth the five stars alone. I was recommended a local restaurant (Turquoise) for my meal on the first evening and unbeknown to me the hotel staff had phoned ahead to tell the restaurant to keep an eye out for me, which as a female traveling alone was very thoughtful. The meal was lovely and I ate there again the following evening using the room service option and also for a lunch on my last day. The room was comfortable, with free Wi-Fi, mini bar and AC - everything a business traveler could need and was an excellent base to my short sightseeing day. The breakfast was held on the sub-ground floor in amongst the remains of a Byzantine Great Palace of Constantinople, which makes you feel like history was is all around you, as was the case generally in Istanbul. I love this hotel for it's unpretentious charm, great location and exceptional staff. I plan to return very soon and would recommend it to all my friends and family as a lovely place to base yourself in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Congratulations to the staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AP_ARCHITECT
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Istanbul after a four day stay at Acra Hotel!The hotel is nicely situated, few steps away from Ayia Sofia and Blue Mosque in the historic part of the city!We had a triple standard room which was adequate as far as size is concerned, had all the amenities and a very nice and large bathroom with marble. The rooms and the rest of the hotel were nicely decorated with traditional touches. The breakfast was nice, not something exquisite but adequate. The most important thing about this hotel which makes it unbeatable was the kindness and helpfulness of the hotel staff!!!Those people believe me are amazing!They are willing to answer any question ,help you with anything you can imagine!Really the staff is what makes this hotel special!Special thanks to Mehmet and Hassan!Thank you all guys!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, friendly and very helpful”
Reviews.Author: EMurrayLondon
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend spent three nights at Acra Hotel. It was our first visit to Istanbul and we found that Hasan and the rest of the reception staff were exceptionally helpful and willing to assist with tour and restaurant recommendations as well as arranging transport for us when visiting locations across the city. The hotel is very well located on a quiet road within minutes of the key city sights. It is small, modern and comfortable. We particularly enjoyed the relaxed reception/lounge area and the complimentary tea and cake in the afternoon. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has it all”
Reviews.Author: amy127-10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Acra only one night but it was terrific. Well situated, extremely helpful staff, historic hotel, comfortable rooms, and great breakfast included. When we returned to Istanbul at the conclusion of our 10 day trip in Turkey, we were booked into another hotel and had wished we could have returned to the charm of the Acra.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious way to end our vacation”
Reviews.Author: KayaKadin
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited several cities in Turkey, beginning with Istanbul and ending back there at the end of our trip before flying back to the states. Acra was by far, the most luxurious of the trip, and it was a great way to finish the vacation in top style and comfort without a high cost. In our other hotels during the trip, it was common to have rooftop dining. But at Acra, we went to the basement instead, which allowed us to appreciate the ancient site the hotel sits on and is built into. The staff at Acra was very friendly and we didn't have any issues checking in VERY late. We were even served apple tea with a smile and pleasant conversation even though it was after midnight! The location is a good one - in fact, I highly recommend staying in Sultanahmet because it's so close to the main sights, is full of restaurants, shopping and feels safe. Acra is tucked into a small street just off a main one and so you don't get a lot of street noise. If you plan on visiting Istanbul, definitely check this hotel out.

Reviews.Title: “Quint and Smart boutique Style hotel”
Reviews.Author: haroon_m
Reviews.Content: I found my stay at Acra hotel, very comfortable. The rooms & bathroom was clean, spacious, and cousy. The receptionists were also very friendly, and very helpful. Anything you needed to know, they had the answers (about Instanbul). Breakfast wasn't too bad, they had all the essentials, but Im used to a bigger variety. Nonetheless, it was sufficient. I would stay here again, just take the address of the hotel before you leave for Istanbul, as taxi drivers tend not to find it, by merely mentioning the hotels name alone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with super service”
Reviews.Author: snoodiemctockish
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious and marble floors throughout the hotel. It was located very close to all the sights in the old city yet far enough away from the noisey nightspots. The lady in reception was really good and added a lovely personal touch to our stay from the time we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “A great location for an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: embdmb
Reviews.Content: The pleasant helpful staff was better than a concierge desk at upscale hotels. Our room was very clean. The buffet breakfast was good. Service to and from the airport was an exceptional perk. The location is excellent, being an easy walk to the most important sights in Istanbul. We would stay here again. We did not encounter a single problem during our six night stay at the Acra Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Frances040
Reviews.Content: This a quality hotel in an ideal location. Within walking distance of all attraction but quiet enough for the most sensitive of sleepers. The staff in particular Lale Kayhan and Yokel are very professional and give silver service to all their quests. I have stayed in quite a few hotels in Istanbul but this one is special. Afternoon tea for the guests is a wonderful gesture. The rooms are spotless and the breakfast was lovely. We enjoyed our stay soo much we stayed longer than we had planned. This was mainly due to the outstanding staff. We felt that the hotel was our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “place you would like to stay again”
Reviews.Author: RenaBaku
Reviews.Content: After many times of travelling to Istanbul and staying in different hotels, i discovered this hotel for myself. The location is just excellent, in the very heart of Istanbul, near Sultan Ahmet, Topkapi and Ayasofya. The hotel itself is very nice, clean, comfortable, with pretty big guest rooms. I think one of the most important distinctive features of each hotel is its personnel. Staff is just amazingly helpfull, they are ready to assist with any issue, you can barely find this kind of attitude in other hotels. Great thanx to Hasan and others! I will definitely advise all my friends to stay in this hotel while travelling to Istanbul and will stay there during my next trip InshAllah!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Amazing hospitality”
Reviews.Author: mfb82
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. The reception were very very friendly and kind. Rooms were clean and very nice. The hotel is located in center of Istanbul old city attractions. You can walk to the blue mosque and Ayasofia. We enjoyed staying there very much. I only find the price a little bit high.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, warm and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Krish64
Reviews.Content: Â My wife and I visited Istanbul 28th Sept 2010 - 2nd October and stayed at the Acra Hotel in Sultan Ahmet. After a 13hr flight from Singapore and a near Kafkaesque experience with Turkish immigration, the welcome at the Acra Hotel was really the balm we weary travelers needed. We chose the Acra based on the numerous positive recommendations we saw for the Hotel on sites like TripAdvisor.com, and we were not one bit disappointed. Â Â  The Acra is located walking distance (max.10mins. to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the Topkapi Palace, the Hippodrome, and the Basilica Cistern, the grand Bazaar etc. but at the same time is away enough from the noisy hustle and bustle, to allow you kick back and relax in peace and quiet after a day of walking the various monuments and heritage sites that make up this beautiful & historical area of Istanbul.Â  The hotel itself boasts a unique feature that I haven't Â quite experienced - the City wall from the Byzantine era, which is bang in the middle of the breakfastÂ area. Not too many hotels can boast of discovering an architectural heritage while their foundation was being dug, but the Acra sure can.Â  The breakfast buffet has a good mix of Turkish and Continental cuisine - we particularly loved the servings of fresh honey at breakfast. Â Â  The rooms are adequately sized and tastefully done up. The ones on the 2nd floor (room nos 402 etc) have a good view of the surrounding are including the Blue Mosque. Plus all the standard amenities,( including what we urban information junkies crave - wireless Internet) were available and worked without a hitch.Â  Â The Acra team made all the difference, with a lot of good suggestions and advice to make the best of one's time in Istanbul (including great places for a meal - which are in abundance all around the hotel).Â Thank you Ozlem, Hasan, Lale and all the others at Acra Hotel for making our stay and the entire Istanbul leg of our Turkey trip so comfortable and memorable. Â Â  Â  Â Â

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: FZA2010
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor and because of it's proximity to the main tourist sites like the blue mosque etc. The hotel itself is small and has rooms spread over three floors with a lift and a restaurant in the basement. The two rooms we had were of a good size and had all the amenities we required such as a fridge, free internet, coffee making facilities, air conditioning etc. I was travelling with my 8 month old baby and other family members and I found that the hotel's proximity to the main sites was excellent. It meant that I was able to walk everywhere and could nip back to the hotel whenever I needed to if baby wanted a nap etc without it being too much of a problem and as the area was very safe I was able to go back without relying on anyone to walk me back, even at night so everyone could carry on enjoying their holiday without interruption. In relation to service at the hotel, I found that for the first couple of days following my arrival the staff were not particularly engaging, however on our final two days I had the pleasure of dealing with different staff members and they were lovely and very very helpful. Unfortunately I do not have their names. Breakfast at the hotel was ok, and you could ask staff for omelettes etc if you wanted them although their english was not very good so it was sometimes a bit difficult to convey what I wanted, however they did their best. Anyone travelling with babies take note that there are no highchairs available here. One other thing that I noticed was that a lot of the hotels in that area had rooftop terraces where you could eat outdoors weather permitting but this hotel does not. Overall my experience at this hotel was a positive one and I would consider booking again if I ever have the pleasure of returning to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: DougDHelsinki
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 4 lovely nights at the Acra Hotel. The location of the hotel, in the heart of Sultanahmet, is ideal if you want to be close to the historic sites like the Blue Mosque, Topkapi, and Agia Sophia. The hotel is less than 2 years old, and very well appointed. The rooms are large and very clean. We stayed in Room 301, which had a small balcony onto the street. The best part of our stay was the service. Hasan, in particular was exceptionally helpful. Both my wife and I are grateful for Hasan's helpfulness and recommendations. The hotel provided decent value for money (although we booked quite late). The breakfast buffet did not have the broadest choice, but was perfectly fine. If I return to Istanbul, we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: ktrempelis
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated in the Sultanahmet neighborhood, in the heart of Istanbul, it is really a family boutique hotel, close to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome and Top Kapi Palace. Even the location is very close to tram station, restaurants, Grand Bazaar and the rest historical monuments at Sultanahmet area. We booked a Family Room whith 2 bedrooms & bathrooms, so it was very comfortable for our family even though it did not have a balcony. I must recomend that the hotel director sent me an e-mail and informed me that the family room i had booked had no balcony and proposed us as an optional to book two separate rooms in the 4th floor with balcony and sea view. But we choosed the Family Room. Rooms are comfortable and very clean. Breakfast is the best I have ever tried. Great hospitality by the staff. They really made us feel at home. My kids loved the attention they got from the staff. The staff was really excellent, helpful and proffesional. Guest parking is complimentary. It's in the front of the Hotel, free and secure. Myself and my family would definitely like to recommend this hotel to anyone and whenever we are back in Istanbul would stay here. They were one of the reason for us to love Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Roxpup
Reviews.Content: Acra hotel is very well located, very close to all of the major sights in Istanbul and close to the tram. It is also one block away from many restaurants. It feels very safe walking in this area, even at night. The hotel is very clean and nice and you get very good value for the price you pay. From the staff, Hasan was particularly helpful in guiding us where to go and what to do. I would consider coming back any time.

Reviews.Title: “VERY HELPFULL STAFF, NICE HOTEL & LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ted7pr
Reviews.Content: The personel of the hotel are very helpfull and polite. The rooms are very good and clean. We felt very comfortable and we have had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Acra tops it as one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in :)”
Reviews.Author: Sara010110
Reviews.Content: great place, great location, great hotel, fabulous service from staff, Hasan is very helpful. Always smiling and no request is a problem for him. he advised us to go to some brillliant restaurants and tourist sites, he really knows his stuff. I would defo reccommend this hotel to anyone, based on service alone. Thank you hasan :-)

Reviews.Title: “A great place, centrally located and as good as everyone says”
Reviews.Author: SilverTraveller
Reviews.Content: Unless you are planning to stay in 6 star luxury, this is the place for you on your first visit to Istanbul. Easy to find and to get back to after you travels around the City. The Blue mosque, Topkapi palace and most tourist attractions are all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great location in the old city.”
Reviews.Author: Bunagus
Reviews.Content: For about US$100 per night, this was a reasonable value. The entire place was spotlessly clean, the room was quite spacious, the bathroom was well appointed, and the service was excellent. Mesut was very helpful and even moved us to a nicer room on our last night as availability changed. The included breakfast consists of a great spread: fruit, fresh honeycomb, breads, cheese, olives, pastries and hot dishes. On our last morning when we had an early departure, the hotel staff accommodated us by setting out a limited breakfast for us well before the normal breakfast hours. The location is excellent - 5 minute walk to the back of the Blue Mosque and a 10 minute walk to the Sultanahmet tram stop, and yet away from the bustle on a nice little side street. The hotel also provides free wi-fi as well as a modern PC in the lobby for guests to use. Tea and pastries are served in the lobby each afternoon. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Acra.

Reviews.Title: “We've been lucky to find Acra among more than 600 hotels in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Couple90
Reviews.Content: Nice pretty New hotel in Old city Sultanahmet. 5 stars location, helpfull and friendly staff especially Lale and Gokay - best regards friends:). We really enjoyed our stay. We occupied a family room which was very convinient for us (a couple with a teenage daughter). It had 2 separate spacious and very pleasantly furnished rooms. We liked the atmosphere and the great idea to arrange the breakfast hall over the ancient foundations. The breakfast was generaly OK but variety could be improved. We would strongly recomend Acra to everybody willing to discover the magic city of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Brazdani
Reviews.Content: I stayed at ACRA , is very close to Blue Mosque at Sultahmet ... very clean and a very good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: S0phie57
Reviews.Content: Acra is a 4 star hotel at the historic centre of Istanbul. Although is a small hotel it reminds you of great, luxurious hotels of another era! My room was very spacious and even the bathroom was quite large! Decoration is very elegant and the staff very professional. The breakfast was excellent. One of the greatest advantages of this hotel is that major historical areas are within a walking distance. You will enjoy walking while enjoying the view of Agia Sophia and other amazing sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: NJPunjani
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my one year old daughter. My wife was a bit reluctant to travel as she was worried about the safety and comfort of the baby, however thanks to Acra Hotel which made our trip extremely pleasing and enjoyable. Key facilities which really helped me during my stay are: 1. Great location â€“ You can see all the key places by walk, also metro station is at waling distance, throughout my 5 days stay in Istanbul I have not spend a single Lira on Taxi 2. Excellent staff and room service - Whatever u want whenever u want, they are there to help you 3. 24/7 hot and cold water in bathroom â€“ 4. Good AC 5. Free baby cot 6. Unlimited tea / coffee 7. Awesome breakfast - No need to rush, all items are available until 10:30 AM. 8. Nice view of Mediterranean Sea. Must ask for room 406 :)

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the Heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JamieWeston
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Istanbul, I discovered this fabulous hotel. A higher- end hotel in the heart of the main tourist area of Istanbul, the Acra is a luxurious place to rest after spending the day sightseeing. It is close to all major tourist sites and we had no problem walking to all of them. Hasan who works at the front desk made our trip easy and hassle-free. He is charming and friendly and quick to offer recommendations for restaurants and outings. He helped us arrange our stay in Istanbul and never steered us wrong. As anywhere in Turkey, the people make all the difference in your trip. The Acra is lucky to have someone like Hasan taking care of its guests. We will definitely be returning to the Acra on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Say Enough Great Things About This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clintonic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in early July while on our Honeymoon. Where do I start... We had the hotel pick us up from the airport and as soon as we came out of the gate there was our driver waiting for us, friendly and with a great sense of humour. We arrived at Acra at about 9pm and Mesut was waiting for us. He immediately proceeded to pull out a map and tell us everything we could possibly need to know about staying in Old Town. Of course Mesut was considerate enough to ask if we were hungry and proceeded to not only make a reccommendation, but also to arrange for pick up and drop off at the restaurant and make the reservations for us. Mesut was working the night shift our entire stay and we relied on him for all of our dinner reccommendations, which were all absolutely fantastic. One night he insisted that he walk with us to show us where the restaurant is as opposed to merely giving us directions. If Mesut is working make sure you get his reccommendation for dinner. The staff here are incredible, Mesut, Oguz and Fatih in particular. Special mention to Mesut who really made our trip spectacular. The rooms are beautiful and completely spotless. The pictures on the internet actually don't do the rooms justice. The Hotel is right in the heart of Old Town, very close to everything and in a very safe location. Breakfast is included and is delicious. I really don't know why you would want to stay anywhere else in Old Town

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: davidmlopes
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel - very freindly and helpful staff - excellent all-round experience. We will return to this hotel when we go back to Istanbul next year. ItÂ´s close to many attractions - just 5 minutes walking distance from the Blue Mosque - everything is convenient and it is close to the Tram Station too - from where you can explore this fascinating city. Rooms are spotlessly clean and very comfortable - you have plenty of space for suitacases etc - without having to fall over them in the middle of the night. We enjoyed our experience and as I said before - "weÂ´ll be back" .

Reviews.Title: “A value deal! Warm welcoming, helpful, smiling & professional staff”
Reviews.Author: AAY75
Reviews.Content: I spent with my wife & kids 5 amazing nights in this hotel. Since the minute we arrived, the staff made us feel royal. They checked us in quickly, even upgraded our room, stored the extra luggage we had and explained to us in details the daily tours we ought to take in addition to what's around. The rooms were tidy and even better than we expected. Breakfast was amazing and we enjoyed the atmosphere of old Istanbul in the breakfast hall. The hotel location is perfect! You will find all kinds of shops around and the bus/tram station is 7-10 minutes walk (with kids) from the hotel. The area around is very safe and you can walk around anytime night & day. A lot of the historical areas you don't want to miss is within a walking distance as well. Front desk always helped, and even negotiated prices, with tour reservations. On the last day, I met the hotel manager who was very keen to know how was our stay in a very professional manner. She's a very professional person who is apparently appreciated by her staff. I'd advice anyone to go there for a memorable vacation. I'd definitely stay there when I go back to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: chellflett
Reviews.Content: i had a lovely time at hotel acra. the staff were very nice and always helpful. Messut was always friendly and kind, very helpful with directions and tourist attractions. i would highly recommended to stay here. i can't wait to come back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Responsive service, great value and excellent position”
Reviews.Author: cawdorMarlborough
Reviews.Content: Arrived very early in the morning and staff found a room within an hour which was not expected on our part but much appreciated. They also allowed us an extension of check out time even though they were fully booked. Lale and the team were very helpful and friendly throughout our stay of about 14 days. Breakfast provided ample choice and good quality in a breakfast area with fascinating foundation and wall remnants of an ancient palace. Room was spacious by european standards, clean and comfortable. The location is conveniant to transport and situated very close to many of the old city sights and sites, ACRA provided a small hotel experience which was good value for money and nicely presented with a pensione feel about it. If you want an upmarket 24 hour room service with spa type hotel, obviously you will go elsewhere. But if you want honest, helpful, friendly service from all staff, comfortable surroundings and fantastic location then this place would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “I will go back soonnnnnnn”
Reviews.Author: pramid
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of historic Istanbul. Perfect for our first trip to the area when we wanted all the major sites within walking distance from our hotel. staff were pleasant with one stand-out lale who went above and beyond by providing us with local eateries, general safety tips/ and ofcourse thanks to all staf(messut'sitki oguz fatih gokay and ofcourse hassan too he was so kind)acra Hotel a memorable, special experience

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to get back again”
Reviews.Author: Robyn025
Reviews.Content: We had a most wonderful time in Istanbul and in central Turkey. The Acra staff were charming and attended to all our needs and this wasn't just during our stay . Oslem in particular was wonderful with her organisation for our central Turkey excursion. Nothing slipped her attention and the excursion ran like clock work. The Acra staff really treat you like a long last family member. Nothing was too much trouble. Everyone greets you with a smile and great charm. Hasan deserves all the praise he receives and more. What a striking ambassador for the hotel and for Istanbul. The hotel is located in a prime position with easy access to all major attractions. It was very good value for money and I look forward to visiting there again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL IN VERY GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: vejuna
Reviews.Content: Before we stayed in Acra hotel we stayed in a City Hotel(4 star),it was not the best experience, as hotel is far from main locations,and in a dodgy area.So we changed to Acra Hotel,which is amazing!!!Very very nice rooms,very good breakfast.Great location 5 min walk to Sultan Ahmed Mosque (the "Blue Mosque") and the the Hagia Sophia.Highly recommend this hotel for everybody!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great from all points of view!”
Reviews.Author: irina_e_nicolescu
Reviews.Content: This is the best choice I have ever made! It`s a beautiful hotel situated in proximity of the most important tourist attractions in Istanbul! I spent here 4 nights and it was absolutely great from all points of view: the hotel itself, the staff, the service everything. I was delighted that one of the staff, a boy called Hasan welcomed us in a way that Istanbul felt like home. He was very nice to give us important tips on how to spend the best holiday in Istanbul! This will surely be our choice the next time we come to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Acra is the unbelievableeee”
Reviews.Author: mahrukhmajid
Reviews.Content: The hotel acra is located in the best place! the quality of their service is absolutely amazing with a friendly atmosphere and specially Hasan, the receptionist was really really friendly. i will recommend this hotel to all my family and friends :D.. good job! Keep it up :D

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delighted!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTootsie
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location in a quiet street but not far from all the action. Immaculate hotel with clean spacious rooms and beautiful decor. The city itself is stunning, I was totally blown away by it, and most importantly the staff at this lovely hotel were incredibly hospitable and made us (group of 7) feel at home, provided excellent information and service. I cannot recommend this hotel enough, I hope to return one day and will definitely look this little gem up. Thank you Lale, Hasan, Atila, Mesut, Ukai, Sikrit and all other staff for making our trip so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: LondonBubbles28
Reviews.Content: I came and stayed at the Acra for 7 days with my family for 7 days. We initially booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor, and we were not disappointed. The Location of the Hotel is great, just a 2 minute walk from The Blue Mosque and Agia Sofiya.... There are plenty of restaurants and bars in the surrounding area along with all other amenities in close proximity. The hotel is beautiful, it has a very cosy atmosphere and is tastefully decorated and very clean. The breakfast was also good and the Chef (sikrit) bakes mouth wateringly delicious cakes. The rooms were spacious and we had a nice little view of the bosphorous. However, more than the hotel itself, I personally feel the staff played a key role in making our holiday complete. I have stayed at many hotels and the staff at Acra are by far the most Accommodating I have come across. Hassan and Lale were superb, always very jolly, talkative, entertaining yet always remaining professional. They had great knowledge of Istanbul and were able to guide us to all the places we wanted to visit with ease. Always a service with a smile. They were very passionate about providing the best service and this was very apparent :-) Mesut, Atila and Yukai (sorry cant remember how to spell the names properly) were also fantastic, again always very helpful and friendly and went out of their way to ensure we had a comfortable and fun stay with them. We felt very safe here and most importantly we always felt like we were coming home at the end of the day and not back to a hotel. I have already recommended this hotel to my colleagues and friends and I myself will be going back to Istanbul in September with my friends, as long as they are happy to give me a room (hee hee), I will be delighted to stay at The Acra again. Thank you so much for making our experience in Istanbul even more beautiful :0) Sadiya Manzoor London

Reviews.Title: “amazing service”
Reviews.Author: paola1975
Reviews.Content: Travelling solo as a single woman it was really important for me to feel safe and compfortable. This hotel catered to my every need and the friendly staff were most considerate.

Reviews.Title: “best place”
Reviews.Author: ozlem50
Reviews.Content: I realy enjoy my trip with help of acra hotel cause they are so friendly and at every stiuation they wanted to help to their customers. I slept very well. I also met with very nice workers especialy Hasan. He and every other workers were so great. I like also hotel area. It is near to the lots of historical places. You dont need to pay lots of bucks to transportation and you dont waste your time.

Reviews.Title: “Really relaxing and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Capuz86
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Acra and we had a great time! The staff has been really well-mannerer and friendly from the welcome till the goddbye. The hotel is almost perfectly positioned: a couple of minutes walking by the Sultan Ahmet square, at the right distance in order not to be disturbed by the chaos of traffic or touristic crowd. Rooms always well kept and cleaned. A real oasis after an intensive days spent running around the city. Special thanks to Hasan and Atila that proved to be good friends as well as very professional by showing us a little part of the Istanbul by night. The only thing we could ask more is to be able to stay there longer! Thanks a lot and good luck to all of you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a very good location!”
Reviews.Author: martiniq
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with Acra Hotel! The staff is very friendly and helpful, the hotel is nice and clean and the rooms were spacious and neatly decorated. The hotel is very easy to find and perfectly located - less than 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, and also very close to a tram stop which made it very easy to reach the hotel from the airport (taking first the metro and then the tram, a whole lot cheaper than taking a taxi). We will definitely come back next time we pass through Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “An Ottoman Palace offering refined quality and care to every customer”
Reviews.Author: CultureVulture86
Reviews.Content: Following the horrendous volcanic ash cloud I was close to cancelling my trip to Istanbul, but I had been looking forward to visiting the much spoken about cultural city for such a long time that I decided that it was worth the risk. After some research and speaking to a few friends who had visited Turkey before, I decided to stay at Acra Hotel for my one weeks stay and what a wise decision that was. After the Taxi drive from Ataturk Airport I was greeted by the warm and friendly staff at Acra hotel at the door. They welcomed me with huge smiles and made me feel welcome straight away. Hasan one of the members of staff was particularly helpful and even drew me a map of the city centre so that I wouldn't get lost during my travels. I have been to many hotels before and have never come across such a friendly, attentive and co-operative member of staff. I had a superior single room decorated with Ottoman style furnishings overlooking the lively city. I can be quite a cynic when it comes to cleanliness in hotel rooms but I have to say that the room smelt of Jasmines when I walked in and cleaners were always around throughout my stay. I was pleased to find that I had wireless access in my bedroom and was able to check my emails whenever I wanted to. Breakfast was served buffet style with a rich variety of Mediterranean delicacies, cheeses, breads, pastries, several ranges of salami, stuffed olives and natural marmalades known as recel. I also found myself fall in love with the traditional Turkish bread called 'simit' which is similar to a bagel and can be eaten alongside the above mentioned. The location of the hotel couldn't have been any better as it was a very short distance away from all of the city's main historical sites. Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar were all a short walk away, I absolutely loved the convenience of being able to pop into my hotel room and back out again to continue with my sight visits. Thanks to Hasan's hand drawn map and useful advice I was able to delve into the city and explore its heritage, culture and all of the Ottoman ruins. Overall I was extremely happy with the quality, value for money and service of Acra Hotel and would return again tomorrow without hesitation. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to visit the city's main historical attractions, dine in an Ottoman fused environment and be welcomed by hospitable and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: BrianValletta
Reviews.Content: We were recommended the hotel by a friend who had stayed there. Certainly worth it. It's central for all the usual main tourist attractions, most of which are within easy walking distance - as is the tram. The reception staff and the support staff were extremely helpful, charming and friendly. Worth staying at!!

Reviews.Title: “Acra Hotel is a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Miss Bollie
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to visit Istanbul look no further than the Acra Hotel. It is located in Sultanahmet, which is the old part of the town and walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Sofia and the attractions. The Hotel is charming and the staff are outstanding, offering a standard of customer service seldom seen in even the largest Hotels. Whether you are looking for a local guide or need assistance in booking tours within Turkey, nothing is too much trouble for this excellent Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: shoesUk
Reviews.Content: Just come back from Istanbul and stayed at the Acra hotel in Sultanamet, its a really lovely place and only a few minutes away from the main sights such as Blue Mosque, Topki Palace etc. The hotel is very clean, modern, comfortable with spacious rooms and nice treats such as complimentary afternoon tea with cakes etc. What really makes this hotel stand out from all others is the staff - they are amazing! They are incredibly friendly and helpful and just want to make sure that as a guest you have the best possible time and experience of Istanbul. Ozlem was great at securing our booking and helping us out when BA threatened strike action and we weren't sure whether we were going to make it there which created a lot of confusion, she was very patient and went out of her way to help. Hasan was great in providing us with tips on where to eat, sights to visit, and places to hang out like bars and clubs, all his recommendations were excellent. All in all, this is the first hotel I have ever stayed at where there was such a high level of consistency in customer service, they really went the extra mile to help. The only downside to this hotel is that the breakfast is very average but then the hotel itself and the staff are so amazing that you don't really care. I will always recommend this place and will stay here next time I visit Istanbul. Thanks Acra for a wonderful stay and everything that you did for us!

Reviews.Title: “great lÄ±ttle hotel Ä±n perfect locatÄ±on wÄ±th very frÄ±endly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: laurie45
Reviews.Content: Acra Ä±s a modern small hotel located wÄ±thÄ±n 5 mÄ±ns walk of the maÄ±n Istanbul tourÄ±st attractÄ±ons. Our room was comfortable wÄ±th a nÄ±ce outlook across the Bosphorus and was a good sÄ±ze for our stay of 7 nÄ±ghts. Always lots of really hot water and for us an Ä±mportant feature of tea and coffee makÄ±ngs (although thÄ±s Ä±s free of charge all day Ä±n the foyer as well). There are many local resturants Ä±n the adjacent streets so the evenÄ±ng meal Ä±s easy to fÄ±nd after a long sÄ±ghtseeÄ±ng day. The staff are very helpful and frÄ±endly and all speak perfect EnglÄ±sh. It was good experÄ±ence and added to our enjoyment of the cÄ±ty.

Reviews.Title: “great staff-great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kewok
Reviews.Content: acra is a wonderful hotel. staff s helpfull and always smiling. rooms are very comfortable and clean but because of thin walls it is noisy we had a great time thanx all acra staff

Reviews.Title: “great staff, very clean and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: graafgeo
Reviews.Content: We (my collegae and me) spent four days in Istanbul en had an great stay at Acra. Very friendly and helpful staff, a clean room in a pretty new builing (on a historical spot). And it is located in a ideal part of Sultanahmet : the street has little traffic and good restaurants are easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “"Acra" Thanks for my lovely holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Suzden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Acra Hotel in March when the flights were delayed, I had stayed at the Hotel a year ago and wanted to go back again, we were so worried we could not get home but this Hotel did their very best to help us enjoy our stay, Hasan was always so cheerful everyday and i felt that i had a friend to look after us! We really liked this hotel..great location, fantastic breakfast each morning, clean with great staff, especially Hasan, who couldn't do enough for us to ensure that we had a very enjoyable stay. Thank you Acra, yet again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff, but flawed”
Reviews.Author: Hastur
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot going for it, really. Its just a short walk from the Blue Mosque, with a fairly quiet location and a street of bars and restaurants one block over. Newly renovated it is in good condition, clean and comfortable. The staff are really wonderful, friendly and welcoming - every time you walk in there is a big smile and a greeting for you and they are always helpful. The problem really is that when they renovated the hotel the owners didn't give one moment's thought to the noise inside. The walls sound like they are made from cardboard and the breakfast area is open so the sound carries through the whole hotel. So after about 6.30am sleep is frequently interrupted by crashing plates and once the service starts by the noise of chatting guests. It wouldn't have been hard to think about this problem when they set out the hotel, and since the main object of a hotel is a place to sleep it fails badly in it's design for guests. Breakfast the first two nights of our stay was fine, good choice, nice quality. But at the weekend suddenly most things had run out by 9am - one morning there was even no bread when we arrived. Quite amazing ...... So some very good points - and a flaw - what score to give! I marked it average, but it will depend on how deep you sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel we have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: EmmaCoburn
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Istanbul after travelling through Italy and Greece and I was very apprehensive about what to expect. I would have to say that Acra was an amazing place to stay as far as the staff and the rooms were concerned. We had our 9 month old son with us and all the staff were so sweet to him and he loved going out to the reception to see them each day. The hotel is convenient to access the historical sites of the city and the staff are only too happy to assist with any questions, directions or necessities.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful discovery during our extended stay in istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: SaraMehmood
Reviews.Content: Due to fly back to London on the 16th April after 5 nights at the more expensive Barcelo Eresin....by chance discovered the Acra on a quiet street in Sultanahmet while waiting for flights to resume. Despite all the tension, we managed to relax and enjoy our stay at the Acra largely thanks to the kindness and warmth of charming staff. What a lovely place, immaculate, cosy, perfectly located.......so many restaurants and shops nearby, all the historic sights. After a leisurely breakfast, then a wander through the bazaars/musuems/art galleries we would meet up with my parents for afternoon tea which is complimentary in the beautiful lounge. Thanks Laleh, Hassan and team. We miss you!!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY AT ACRA HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: SandyKalogri
Reviews.Content: Really nice and centrally located hotel.Staff was wonderful,very very kind and Hassan at the reception was the best !!Also Leila and Messud. Large and very comfortable room and also very clean.Fantastic breakfast and with 10 as best average we give 10 to this hotel.A very big thanks to all of you there and keep going like that!!!Hope to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely refuge in a volcanic ash storm”
Reviews.Author: FarmingtonUtah
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the lovely Acra Hotel for a planned vacation of 6 nights, which turned into 9 nights due to the Iceland volcano. We could not have picked a better home away from home. We were treated with kindess and concern and the beautiful rooms and wonderful amenities are second to none. Thank you to all the staff! We would never hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Really good!!!”
Reviews.Author: mbg_mode
Reviews.Content: We spent a great vacations in this hotel located in the heart of Istanbul. It takes you only 3-5 minutes to get main attractions.the people working in the hotel were very friendly & helpful espiacilly Hasan...I recommend this hotel to everyone ...

Reviews.Title: “great location and frindly staff”
Reviews.Author: arnoldboy123
Reviews.Content: it was a pleasure to stay at the acra hotel my room was spaciouse and comfortable and the staff were very very friendly espeacially mesut at reception he was always very polite and a good totalk to i enjoyed myself and hope to come back soon

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: strawberrypieLondon
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. As already mentioned by the other reviewers, the staff are extremely friendly and cheerful. Breakfast is great and plentyful. It's served on the lower ground floor of the hotel which has been nicely decorated but doesn't get a lot of natural light - a terrace or some outdoor space would probably be nicer in the summer. The rooms are comfortable and very clean although the walls are quite thin. Short walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. However, if you would like to check out some of the cool restaurants and bars in Istanbul, you may be better off staying in a different part of town (around Galata tower maybe).

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, nice rooms but REALLY THIN Walls”
Reviews.Author: DC_girlinLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expecations. They arranged an airport transfer for us from the hotel and greated us with enthusiasm at 1 AM when we arrived. I cannot say enough good things about the staff - they made bookings for us, arranged taxis, recommended good restaurants, and answered all of our many questions with enthusiasm that you don't see in London. The room was also very nice - good sized, comfortable bed. Very clean bathroom and good sized with a relatively 'normal' shower. The location is perfect - walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, and a nice strip of restaurants and bars - very safe and clean. The breakfast was also outstanding for a European continental breakfast - two types of eggs, six different cereals, lots of fruit, jams, meats and cheeses, juice - all included in the price. My only complaint is the thin walls (and windows). Our first morning (a Friday) we were awakened by the call to prayer at 5.30. I recognise that this is probably common in Istanbul, and especially given the proximity to the Blue Mosque. So that's forgivable. However, we could hear every word of the family next door, including their lovely crying baby, and even when they were talking in normal voices. We asked if we could change rooms and were told that the only room available had two twin beds. Surprisingly, this was the only time that the staff were a bit rude - as if we had no right to even ask. I would definitely recommend this hotel, but you might want to bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Luxury in the heart of the old town”
Reviews.Author: AfricanCup
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel which feels fresh and new. The rooms are spacious with queen size bed and 2 armchairs. We even had views of the Bospherous. The wooden floor, central heating and air con made it comfortable. Staff were super friendly especially Leila at reception who really cared and wore her heart on her sleeve - they really want their guests to feel at home. The bath was a bit small - but never mind. There was plenty of variety for breakfast - with a Turkish theme - which some may find monotonous. Location wise the hotel is 5 minutes walk from Aya Sofia/ Blue Mosque/Topkapi/Tram. Brilliant! The streets nearby are filled with great Turkish and fish restaurants and also quite a few bars. Also the cobbled streets make it so romantic and you can wake up with great views. The high tea in the afternoon is to die for! One of the best hotels I have stayed at...at the price we paid, a real bargain and a brilliant locations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, perfect Location! Couldn't have asked for more.....”
Reviews.Author: LondonLJH
Reviews.Content: From arrival we were treated beyond our expectations. we had a lovely room and the tea and cakes on arrival were very much welcomed! On our first night we didn't have any plans, the hotel recommended a couple of restaurants which were excellent (i would recommend going to Antique Turquoise and choosing the rock fish...Yum!) the room was modern and clean and is in the middle of the old town, within a 5 minute walk to all the tourist attractions (Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque etc etc).... the hotel were happy to book our tours and hamams which made things so easy for us... All in all an excellent experience i would definately return.... :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca080
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The people at the reception were really helpful and nice. Especially Hasan. The rooms were clean and the breakfast was

Reviews.Title: “This is a really nice hotel and the location is fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: titca
Reviews.Content: Just home fro IStanbul 13 hours ago. Acra is a new nice hotel ( only 10 months old in March 2010). The location is perfect close to all sights in Old City and the tram is quit close too. It is quit in the night. Our rooms were big, good beds, good bathrooms. But what makes this hotel is the staff. Seldom you meet people at the front desk with such a passion for what they are doing. The are proactively helpful, they offer you options or nicely suggest better choices if you are checking with them own thought.s/plans They are also funny and positive. We laughed a lot with them. I big extra plus to Hasan and Lale. And Mesut. The terrace is not built yet. That is the only minus. But the great breakfast buffet among the ruins of an old castle is nice. And the terrace will come. The lift already goes up to that floor ( we checked). This city is really nice in March/April and September /October. Good weather then and not too many tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!Best hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: katerinaAthens
Reviews.Content: Dear friends, This hotel is the best hotel I have ever stayed in, and I have been abroad almost 10 times before. Do not search any further. You found the BEST!!! I can not find words to describe what me and my husband experienced in this hotel. The staff all of the guys and especially the lady in the reception made us feel at home. Very friendly and warm, I almost feel them as my friends. The best staff ever. The hotel is in a very good location next to the Blue Mosque, around a 5 min. walk. The neighborhood is very nice also, very colourfull, and peacefull. Rooms are big enough, very clean, very elegant, with an excellent big bed and fine pillows, and very nice decorated. Bathroom is also big and very nice. The hotel is new and so it looks like it. Breakfast has a lot of variety. It covers all tastes. Breakfast room is very big and ellegant. The personnel also in the breakfast room, so kind and friendly. In our trip happened both of us to be ill and we never feld bad and miserable thanks to this wonderfull staff. They provided us with everything we needed. (Thank you guys for all - You are simply the BEST)... Best quality and price hotel that you will ever experience. Its not big words it is simply the truth. There are a lot of good restaurants nearby, but I think that in Beyoglou they are more and maybe better. Turquoise restaurant nearby the hotel is nice but not the best. Istanbull is a nice city, but very much crowded. It gets dizzy to walk around sometimes and in some very crowded places. Agia Sophia is a must, Top Capi, Bosporous cruise and all the rest, but in my opinion Yerebatan Sarayi (Vasilikes kinsternes) is a MUST see. Hope I helped a little in search of a good hotel. "Dear friends from Acra hotel many thanks and hope to see you again". Keep up this excellent job.. With love Katerina and Vagelis from Athens....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Bir0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Acra Hotel in the last january (2010), during 5 nights. It was perfect, since our reception at the airport, where the was someone waiting us, until our departure! The AcraÂ´s staff was very attentive. It called us attention the warm reception at the hotel, when they provided us a very confortable room (corner suite 404), and a lot of options to dinner in the neighbourhoods, taxi etc. The accomodations are very spacious, clean, confortable (in terms of temperature and noise as well), and the furniture is classical e quite sofisticated. Do not hesitate to choose this hotel in your next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in "Sultan Ahmet" with good services!”
Reviews.Author: RSHolland
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good & clean hotel in "Sultan Ahmet" I can recomment the Acra hotel! I have stayed here for 2 nights. I have to say that the Management & Reception staff were very helpful and offering help and advice. Mister Mesut from the reception helped me with searching a hotel in Bursa(Uludag). The breakfast in the hotel was good to eat. In short to say it is a nice and comfortable hotel to stay if you are alone or with your family or friends! Hopefully see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “If service and being made to feel comfortable is important to you, this is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sheridanroad
Reviews.Content: Location and some reviews led us to make a reservation at the Acra Hotel. It was a great place to stay! Never have we found a more hospitable and knowledgable staff. For approx. $100.00 a night, breakfast, free access to internet, airport transfers, and taxes included, it cannot be beat. Reserve room 401, or similar, for a larger room. We were on an around the world trip and while we stayed at more elegant hotels during our travels, none were more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: aldo257
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Acra for 6 nights February 13th to February 19th 2010. I have never met staff as brilliant as those at the Acra Hotel, especially Hasan and Mehmet. Nothing was too much trouble for them, they could not do enough for us. The breakfast at the Acra was magnificent , everything one could want was available, and the breakfast room itself was a really lovely room. When one returned to the hotel at any time of day, in the reception area, there was tea, coffee, cakes and pastries available throughout our stay. The hotel is situated in a wonderful location, only a few hundred metres from the Blue Mosque, Ayasofya, Topkapi Palace, The Basilica Cistern and Gulhane Park, as well as the Metro. We enjoyed our time in Istanbul tremendously, and when we return again, we certainly intend to stay at the Acra Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel, with really nice staff”
Reviews.Author: MiriamGS86
Reviews.Content: The staff was really helpfull, Hasan Yavuz, in the reception, in the recomend us good places the rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel is in a really good place, close to the main atractions. We really enjoy the stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect servise and good service from yavuz hassen”
Reviews.Author: ameni
Reviews.Content: thank u for best service and specially to yavuz hassen

Reviews.Title: “Six out of five stars”
Reviews.Author: malnit
Reviews.Content: After a bit of research on tripadvisor we booked the two connecting double bedrooms for a four night stay in Istanbul. Our stay was great, and the hotel was so close to the sights in Sultanahmet that travel was always convenient (even a taxi ride to Beyoglu, an essential visit for any trip to Istanbul, was only about fifteen minutes away). The staff would enquire about our day when we returned each evening, and provide helpful hints/tips to us. Ozlem the manager, Lale, Mehmet, and Hassan were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Our teenage children enjoyed interacting with them and learnt some Turkish phrases from them. Rooms were clean and spacious; breakfast was a good and appetising spread; rooms were cosy and warm with Istanbul covered in snow. We would definitely consider coming back to Acra the next time we go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel with a very good location!”
Reviews.Author: MiguelOeiras
Reviews.Content: If you go to Istambul go to this Hotel! ItÂ´s not expensive, the rooms are very clean and the staff is great ( thanks to Hasan, Mesut and Oguz ). The Hotel is located in the Historical centre 300 mts from Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque and you can walk to almost the turistic attractions, like the Turkish bathÂ´s, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar and other Mosques. ItÂ´s in the centre but itÂ´s very quiet and you can relax if you want. The only thing that I have to point itÂ´s the breakfast that is always the same with medium quality. Go there and you will not regret your choice!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alenka10
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel, the personnel is very kind and professional. Hasan Yavuz on the reception helped us in all we needed. Hotel makes you feel at home with it's smiling face& friendly personnel , high quality service and very comfortable rooms. Everything in the Hotel is perfect. Location is very good, you can reach everywhere in couple of minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with excellent services.”
Reviews.Author: Hanwhizz
Reviews.Content: Acra hotel is a unique hotel located in the heart of the historical area of Istanbul.It is a excellent hotel with excellent services and staffs.The hotel was very clean and the rooms are spacious,comfortable with beautiful secenary.Acra hotel receptionist,Mr Hasan Yavuz,Mehmet Gurbuz,and Mesut Cecen are the best receptionist in Acra Hotel.They provide excellent services to us and everytime we returned to the hotel from visiting we will be served with snacks and drinks in the lobby.The morning breakfast covered most of my taste back home and I appriated the effort of the chef on all this.It is the most interesting,valuable and comfortable hotel to choose for vacation in Istanbul with family or friends moreover with great deal!Don't forget to look for the recepetionist I've mention above....they can provide anything you want from Istanbul. Dont miss it...Is a chance to live in a unique and comfortable hotel in the heart of the historical area!!

Reviews.Title: “Very thin walls - can be difficult to sleep at night”
Reviews.Author: ygpsydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Yes it is located to all the major sights in Istanbul BUT be prepared to be hassled by touts the moment you step out of the hotel. Some of the touts are not always polite and can be aggressive in their behaviour which we did not appreciate. Have a look at the area called Beyoglu. It is a better area and you wont be hassled every step of the way. There are fewer hotels in this area and you may have to look. It is only a very small difference in distance to all the sights in Istanbul. Easy to get to sights. The service in the hotel was good and the room was clean and neat. Heating worked well during the cold weather we experienced in Turkey. A really big negative was the paper thin walls which have no sound insulation. The result was that we could hear every single sound from the next room. I am not talking muffled sound but crystal clear voices and every single word in the conversation was heard. We complained the first night and was moved. The second room was the same. We were told that the room was occupied by a single person. We thought that was good till we found out that he then spent most of the evening on the phone. I must add that the conversations in the next room were very ordinary in the sound levels and not loud. However due to no insulation and paper thin walls - it was difficult to sleep. After the move on the second day - we gave up complaining as we understood that all the roooms would be constructed the same. Also look at going outside of the touristy areas as part of your stay in Turkey. We did not like the aggressive behaviour of some whose only objective was to get money out of tourists by getting you to buy their goods and eat in their restaurants. Restaurants and goods in tourist areas of Istanbul was expensive in comparision to other European cities Use the public ferry - very cheap and easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: monkey123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Acra hotel for a 4 night long weekend break and had a wonderful time there. The room was clean and well appointed, with a comfortable bed and enough space for some plush chairs by the window. The bathroom was spotless, with a powerful in-bath shower and pretty good quality toiletries. The breakfast buffet was simple, but fresh, well presented and tasty - and set in a lovely room built around some Byzantine (I think!) ruins. The hotel itself is in a fantastic location being only a few minutes' walk away from some of Istanbul's biggest tourist attractions such as Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque, whilst at the same time being tucked away in a quiet enough street so that you're not disturbed by any crowds (OK - it was January). We found it very easy to get to all of the city's tourist attractions as if they weren't in walking distance, the tram stop was only a 7 minute walk away. Finally, the staff were fantastic and couldn't do enough to help. We'd definitely go back to this hotel on a future visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Facinating culture and landscape”
Reviews.Author: thegreatgatesofkiev
Reviews.Content: The Acra Hotel is located in the Sultanahmet area of old Istanbul described as a boutique hotel. It is within 5 minute walking distance from the famous Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, the Tokapi Palace, and many more palaces and mosques within walking distance of each other. The hotel is built over a 2000 year-old Byzantine wall with the dining room on the same level. The rooms are very comfortable with good central heating system during winter. The hotel is renovated with qualities of old colonial charm embellished with ceiling roses, chandeliers and wrought iron banisters along the stairs. The breakfast is simple and adequate. However, anyone who likes rose petal jam and hazelnut spread will find their breakfast a treat. Due to the size of our group, we organized to have cakes and beverages available during the afternoon for a reasonable cost and they made the goodies available till about 10 pm at night. The tea and cakes were a welcome homecoming to the hotel after a long excursion. The staff are very helpful and willing to bend over backwards to give a hand. I personally felt that the staff not only did their jobs but cared. If and when I do go to Istanbul again, I will definite book into the Acra.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Sr_Superdry
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Istanbul. Very clean, very big rooms, an amazing location (5 minutes walking to Blue Mosque...) and the best staff. We've spent three nights and was perfect; a big and very clean room, with a big and clean bathroom as well. Big beds, everything new and tidy. Perfect for every purpose. Great rooms. Perfect location. Clean and tidy. GREAT staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & very friendly hotel - ideal location”
Reviews.Author: PXTLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find, excellent location right next to the blue mosque and Ayia Sofia and the Underground Cistern. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very welcoming. Our receptionist Lelia was a delight and very helpful as were the rest of the staff. Breakfast was good with a reasonable variety and would cover most tastes - Continental style. Bedroom,showers and main lobby were all very clean and the shower was excellent.
