Complementary tea/coffee and cake in lobby which was greatly appreciated when we got back late afternoon from a full day exploring & shopping. Can't fault this place - well done Acra & all it's staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish traditional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: larasmith81
Reviews.Content: What a lovely Hotel! was not expecting it to be like this when we arrived, and what a lovely warm welcome we had from the guy in the reception! Every day he drop every thing the minute i came through the door with such a lovely smile as well! Turned out his name was Hasan Yavuz , and he made us feel very special! the rooms were beautiful, and although the choice of breakfast was a little limited it was fresh and tasty, also it was just in the right spot for all the sights and the best choice of restaurants are all nearby as well.We would certainly come back to Acra Hotel again, maybe do it all again this October!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: SmirkingPixie
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place to stay - lovely boutique hotel, perfectly situated for most of the attractions - Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace etc, not to mention numerous bars and restaurants. Staff could not have been more helpful, supplying cables for our laptop, a spare adaptor and suggesting places to visit. Breakfast was slightly disappointing in terms of variety but don't let this put you off. Make sure you visit the Oz Bar in the next road - great staff, lovely wine!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AltheaVestrit
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in, we knew we had a found a gem in Istanbul! Near to all the sights, the Acra is both clean, beautiful and convenient. The staff are amazing and made our stay in Istanbul feel like a trip to visit old friends. Look for Hasan Yavuz at the front desk. He greeted us with a smile and made us feel welcome from the moment we wearily checked in after a long flight. He is extremely helpful and not only helped us plan our sightseeing but also helped with small details such as where to buy tea and how to package our souvenirs so they'd make the trip back home safely. A must stay if you are visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Like at home.”
Reviews.Author: Jrico
Reviews.Content: Ä°t is a warm and welcoming hotel;the reception people are easy to approach and make you feel at home,you can have a nice laugh wÄ±th Hasam and Lale. I am very grateful. Juan Antonio

Reviews.Title: “Acra - The Place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: aiyazkhot
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected after much R & D for my Honeymoon stay and to my surprise it surpassed all my expectations... The rooms are filled with a delightful aroma and have a very nice and elegant decor all together.....Hotel staff are immensely hospitable and friendly...never come across anyone in the tourism industry as such... The best of all is the Breakfast which is too good !!! and yes ofcourse the complimentary Turkish Tea Coffee and cookies... I would definitely want to stay there again. All the Sightseeing hotspots of the IStanbul city tour are walking distance of about 5 minutes from the hotel in the fabulous and lovely setting of Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a excellent acomodation in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jeannine_myl
Reviews.Content: We are a group of 4 friends(1 couple and 2 singles) and we chose the familly room. The room was very spacious and contained two seperate rooms,recently renovated(everything was knew),exemplarily clean(actually the cleaning ladies even gave their own personal touch when folding our pijamas.so sweet..!),luminous(3 big windows). The breakfast restaurant was very big and surprisingly built on ancient ruines carefully elected.The breakfast was very rich and the eggs were cooked instantly at order.Only the fruits weren't very fresh.The breakfast waiters were very welcoming. The personel was extremelly friendly,smily,welcoming and always ready to give us the best advices.Actually the places for dinner and hamam we were recomended by the receptionist were very good and weren't tourist traps as usual. Tea and cake was often available durring the day at the loby.All these made us fell completly like at home. The location of the hotel was excellent,just a few minutes walk from all the major touristic sites. The transport to and from the airport was trully a great advantage. The only flaw in the hotel was that the internet connection provided didnt function at my laptop.But I could serve the computer available at the loby. All in all,I believe that the foremost advantage of this hotel is the excellent equivalence of quality and price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, fantastic rooms & staff!”
Reviews.Author: Katerinask
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor and I have to say we weren't let down. We couldn't have asked for more in terms of the rooms, service or location - and all this for an extremely reasonable price. The hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Sultanahmet (just around the corner from the main sights and the Four Seasons Hotel), plus it is quite new, so there is still a very fresh feel about it. Overall, I would recommend this to anyone traveling to Istanbul - you won't be disappointed! PROS: spacious rooms, beautifully decorated, all amenities in room (tea, coffee, hair dryer, safe etc), very generous buffet breakfast, lovely building (reception, common areas etc), extremely helpful and friendly staff, free wifi in rooms, plus a PC in reception with printer, excellent location (5 minute walk to Agia Sofia, Blue Mosque etc), quiet, clean, warm and all at a very good price (we payed 350 euros for a double room for 5 nights in mid Dec using the early booking discount on their website). CONS: if I really had to mention something, I would say that if you are visiting in the summer, you may be disappointed by the lack of a roof terrace for breakfast (we were there in Dec so it didn't really matter), but you can always enjoy a coffee on one of the gazillion cafes/hotels nearby whenever you want! In conclusion, one of the best hotels we've ever stayed at :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cadebond
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from an amazing trip to Turkey, part of which was made so by the Acra Hotel. It was a pleasure to be greeted each morning by the very friendly Lale and Ozlem before a leisurely stroll to all of the sites in Istanbul that are very close by. An absolute pleasure to stay and and would recommend to anyone travelling to Istanbul, and I definitely will as I am a travel agent! Thanks again everyone at the Acra Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Possible the best hotel value/prize in Estambul”
Reviews.Author: FranciscoComin
Reviews.Content: I decided to choose this hotel becouse of the good reviews that I reed before, And I have to tell you thay I have a marvellous time in hotel Acra. The rooms are very good decorated, But the best of all is The Staff who is working there. They are super charmant and professional.Thanks so much I wvill recomended for everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience - look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: jacqwong
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights with a break in between and were not too impressed. Here's some of the reasons: - Make reservations 2 1/2 months in advance for a Superior triple room and got confirmation for it. Upon arrival at 1pm, I was whisked to a small standard room facing a wall. There were hardly any space to move about in that tiny room for the 3 of us. Make a complaint at the reception and was told that they were fully booked. I was upset and I showed them the e-mail that they will reserve a triple room for me. After showing my dissatisfaction, we were given a Superior triple room (very puzzling as a moment ago, we were told that all triple rooms were all occupied). - Due to cancellation of our internal flights by the airport, we had to change our plans, so I checked with the reception and was told that we can stay in our room for 2 more nights by the night shift person at the reception. However, the morning shift person at the reception told us that we have to move out as our room has been allocated to others. After some arguments, she told us to stay put in our room. Eventhough the hotel is only 6 months old, it is beginning to show some signs of aging. The bathroom water does not flow properly and the tub is always flooded when we bathe. We told the reception about the problem and was told it had been fixed. We lived with the flooded bathtub until we checked out as we do not want to complaint anymore. There are many other hotels along the street where Acra is, so look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional”
Reviews.Author: valentine72
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, myself and my friend received excellent service and hospitality from the hotel staff. The hotel itself is a real find and i would certainly recommend this to anyone wishing to visit the lovely city of Istanbul as it is ideally located too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: BRASerbia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this new hotel in late November. Everything was much better than I expected, even before I arrived: they answered my email and handled my reservation very promptly and in a polite way. I also used their airport transfer and the driver was waiting for me in spite of some delay of the plane. Once in the hotel I faced a fully personalized service: the receptionist greeted me warmly and gave me some orientation information about the location, transportation, attractions etc. The room was exceptional, very tastefully appointed, with a huge bed, two nice armchairs, a Turkish kilim, elegant bathroom, all in all almost a Hyatt luxury but with a touch of tradition. Itâ€™s a very, very clean and excellently maintained hotel. Buffet breakfast is served in the basement with some remains of the old Byzantine palace discovered in situ. For the breakfast there was a big choice of everything, but my favorite was the cheese pie with yogurt! The hotel is located in a small street below the Blue Mosque (Sultanahmet area), which guarantees a peaceful stay (almost no traffic in the street). In the close vicinity is a tram stop for Kabatash, from where one can reach the hectic Taxim Square by a new funicular. If you are looking for an excellent hotel in Istanbul and can afford the price, then search no further! (This is an opinion of someone who has been in tourism business for more than 30 years).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing city, amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AAM30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel following the recommendation we saw in several blogs and sites and could not have had a better decision! The hotel is located in the most fascinating part of the city (Sultanhammet), walking distance from the main mosques and bazaars. The staff was incredibly nice, very helpful and friendly. The room was a perfect boutique hotel room: very spacy, clean, with small luxury items available at the bathroom and room. We spent 5 nights there and recommended it for everyone! Planning to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, well worth a stay.”
Reviews.Author: SJK5
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Istanbul for 5 days, and loved every minute of it. Istanbul is a great city to visit, with lots of beautiful sites to see. As an all female group we felt safe sight seeing in Istanbul. After a couple of long days out on tours organised through the hotel, it was a relief to come back to the comfort of the Acra Hotel. This hotel is just minutes away from the amazing Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. There are loads of restaurants just 5 minutes walk from the Hotel Acra, so no need to worry about where to eat! Our favourite was the Albura Kathisma Restaurant. The staff at the Acra were very friendly and helpful and most importantly, English speaking! The rooms are adequately sized and are cleaned daily, the bathroom was very up-to-date with all the mod-cons. Overall, we thought Turkey was beautiful, and it's people friendly and warm. Our experience was made better by ALL the pleasant staff at the Acra Hotel, namely Mustafa, Osman (AKA Osama) & Mehmet.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful”
Reviews.Author: marcel036
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul in early October for our honeymoon. The hotel is located near the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. The hotel is new, has free internet in the lobby. The rooms are nicely furnished, queen bed and armchairs. Breakfast is served in the basement, spacious with variades meals. The staff is very friendly, Mehmet Hasan has helped us greatly. We booked excursions from the hotel, and everything worked OK.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with fantastic staff!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fguillon
Reviews.Content: The Acra Hotel's location in the Sultanahmet quarter is idea for exploring; the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and Topkapi Palace are within easy walking distance as are abundant shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: zebidee
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in Istanbul at the Acre. The staff are very friendly and helpful. They will try to sell you tours and packages but wont hassle you if you explain you're not interested. The rooms (we moved half way through so got to experience two) were clean, comfortable and fairly spacious,though they didn't have views. The call to prayer could be heard in the morning so if you are a light sleeper it will wake you. The rooms had fridges, safes and tvs and bathrooms with good showers. The location really couldn't be better. You can stroll around the corner to the blue mosque, the palace, the hippodrome and hagia sophia and from there either walk or tram to the grand bazaar or up to the bosphorus. There are lots of restaurants near the hotel though they are all very touristy. We visited the area with all the fish restaurants (can't remember the name) but the best food we ate was north of the golden horn where the smart Istanbul crowd seemed to gather. At lunch we either ate street food (the fish which they catch, grill and put in a bread roll down on the river is definitely worth trying) or cafes where you can point to the meze you want. The breakfast in the hotel is good though it did get a bit samey - we tended to eat light so we had room for lots of food at lunch. If you get a very good value deal, as we did, I can't see you regretting staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new and quiet location with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Nico_Jong
Reviews.Content: From the moment of entry till our departure the staff was always very kind and helpful. The hotel is new and located in a quiet Sultanahmet street, only a couple of minutes from the Blue Mosque and Agia Sofia. Plenty of restaurant facilities around the corner. The rooms are big, the beds perfect and include a spacious wardrobe with your own safe. The breakfast buffet is extensive and well tended. Free use of guest computer in the lobby, e.g. for e-checkin.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel: view, value, service, sanitary, location, got it all”
Reviews.Author: travelingFelix
Reviews.Content: Located in Sultanhamet near the Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque, this is a great hotel. Modern decor, very clean, spacious rooms, great service, friendly, views of the Bosphorus. You cannot go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RHMcK
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that is central to the cultural high points in the city, has a superb choice of restaurants and extensive shopping within 2-300 metres could not do better than choose the Acra Hotel in Istanbul. We have just returned from a seven night stay at the hotel and we had a superb time there. The staff were very friendly and couldn't do enough to help with any queries we had or things that we wanted to organise. The choice at breakfast was very extensive, appetising and nice. In most cases we eat so well we didn't need to have a midday meal! Our air-conditioned bedroom was very well equipped, comfortable and spacious, with a very nice marble tiled bathroom. The only negative point we have about the room was the view we had, which wasn't great, however I am sure that had we asked, the staff would have been happy to move us. All in all a great place to stay in a wonderful and captivating city.

Reviews.Title: “magic hotel,great staff”
Reviews.Author: andiamooooooo
Reviews.Content: magic hotel, great location, room fantastic (if it's availabe, ask for the 404..great view). Staff is really friendly. Can't find anything negative.

HotelInfo.Name: Acra Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Mimar Mehmet Aga Cad. Amiral Tafdil Sok. No:15 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul, Turkey
